Title: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1660 Review: The Turing Onslaught Continues
Summary: By trimming a couple of SMs from TU116 and swapping GDDR6 for GDDR5 memory, Nvidia turns GeForce GTX 1660 Ti into a vanilla 1660. Does the $220 Turing-based board retain enough performance to outmaneuver Radeon RX 590, though?
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Corsair One Pro i180 Review: Full Power in a Tiny Tower
Summary: Content creation professionals, take note. Corsair’s compact One Pro i180 is compact, powerful, and (mostly) quiet.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Wooting One Keyboard Review: Analog Switches, Great for Your Digits
Summary: The Wooting One is a compact keyboard that stands alone, thanks to its analog switches and customizable actuation point.
Author: Alex Cox

Title: Asus ROG Strix Z390-E Gaming Review: Stretching The Envelope
Summary: Intel’s Core i9-9900K has pushed mid-level enthusiast motherboard pricing well into what was once considered the high-end. Can Asus’s Z390-E Gaming win this market?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Patriot Viper Steel DDR4-4400: One Speedy Serpent
Summary: There's no steel here, but the performance is real: Patriot’s DDR4-4400 kit is the best-performing 2x8GB model we’ve tested.
Product_Name: Patriot Viper Steel DDR4-4400: One Speedy Serpent
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Antec Torque Case Review: Pretty Vacant
Summary: The Antec Torque joins a new class of open-air chassis of similar appearance. Does it have the features or performance to to earn our recommendation?
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: Lenovo Legion Y740 Gaming Laptop Review: Smooth Operator
Summary: The Lenovo Legion Y740 performs as well as it looks. Unfortunately, some physical flaws, like a nose-shooting webcam and weak keyboard hold it back.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: Acer Predator XB273K 4K 144Hz Monitor Review: The Next Best Thing
Summary: The Acer Predator XB273K is a 27-inch HDR, 4K monitor with G-Sync, 144Hz and DCI-P3. Not only is it a killer gaming screen, it goes toe-to-toe with pro displays.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Asus ROG Thor 1200W PSU Review: Asus Brings a Screen to the PSU Party
Summary: The ROG Thor 1200W is Asus' new top PSU, made in collaboration with Seasonic. It features high performance and silent operation.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Scythe Kotetsu Mark II TUF Gaming Alliance Cooler Review
Summary: Scythe Kotetsu MkII: Budget RGB cooling designed for overclocking mainstream processors.
Product_Name: Scythe Kotetsu Mark II TUF Gaming Alliance Cooler Review
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: HP Omen X 65 Emperium Monitor Review: 65 Inches of Gaming Greatness
Summary: In the world of premium gaming monitors, it doesn’t get bigger, better, or pricier than HP's 4K Omen X 65 Emperium, with HDR, G-Sync, 144Hz, and killer audio.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Alienware Aurora R8 Gaming Desktop Review: Strong and Chunky
Summary: The Alienware Aurora R8 is a bulky gaming rig that offers strong performance and a whole lot of ports.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Corsair Dominator Platinum RGB 32GB DDR4-3600 C16 Review: Bright Lights, Speed City
Summary: More RGB, more performance. What else does Corsair’s latest Dominator Platinum kit have in store for us?
Product_Name: Corsair Dominator Platinum RGB 32GB DDR4-3600 C16
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: AMD Athlon 240GE and 220GE Review: Retaking the Low Ground
Summary: AMD rounds out its Athlon stack with the $65 220GE and $75 240GE.
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: HP SSD EX950 NVMe M.2 SSD Review: Geared for Gaming
Summary: HP’s SSD EX950 is a wicked fast NVMe M.2 SSD that ranks as one of the best on the market.
Product_Name: HP SSD EX950 NVMe M.2 SSD
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Origin PC Neuron Review: Good Performance and Style (Update)
Summary: The Origin PC Neuron delivers impressive performance and can be customized however you like, but can run loud and needs dust protection.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: SilverStone SX700-G PSU Review: An Overclocked SX650-G?
Summary: The SX700-G was the first SFX-based PSU to offer 700W of power in such a small form factor. Basically, it is an overclocked version of the SX650-G, since it is based on the same platform.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Dell UltraSharp U4919DW Monitor Review: Two 27-inch QHD Screens in One
Summary: Tired of the bezel line between your two 27-inch QHD screens? The Dell UltraSharp U4919DW is the perfect solution. It’s a gently curved 49-inch panel with 5120x1440 resolution and precise color.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Pimax 5K Plus Review: A Fresh Look at Ultrawide VR
Summary: The Pimax 5K Plus VR headset isn't perfect. We wouldn’t trade it for a Vive Pro, but we'd consider it if we were upgrading from the original Vive.
Author: Kevin Carbotte

Title: Riotoro Morpheus GPX-100 Review: Forward-Looking Design, Some Assembly Required
Summary: Riotoro’s shape-changing chassis impresses with its versatility, excellent cooling, quiet operation and future-looking features.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: Google Pixel Slate Review: Premium, But Pricey
Summary: Those looking for a Google alternative to the iPad Pro will appreciate Google’s latest tablet. But when you factor in the keyboard, you can get a more powerful, more capable Windows device for less.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Scythe Choten TUF Gaming Alliance Review
Summary: Scythe Choten TUF Gaming Alliance – an RGB downdraft cooler with the upside of being budget friendly
Product_Name: Scythe Choten TUF Gaming Alliance Review
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Nvidia Titan RTX Review: Gaming, Training, Inferencing, Pro Viz, Oh My!
Summary: Nvidia's Titan RTX is intended for data scientists and professionals able to utilize its 24GB of GDDR6 memory. It's also a mean gaming card, if you have $2,500 for top shelf frame rates.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Corsair AX1000 PSU Review: Titanium-Class Efficiency, at a Premium Price
Summary: Corsair and Seasonic teamed up to create the latest high-end AX power supply family. The AX1000 isn't a digital platform, but it still serves up exceptional performance.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Huawei Matebook 13 Review: Good Value, Short Endurance
Summary: The Huawei MateBook 13 has sleek, Mac-inspired looks and strong performance, but it suffers from weak battery life.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Gigabyte Aero 15 X9 Gaming Laptop Review: RTX Works, AI Bores
Summary: Gigabyte’s Aero 15 X9 is a sleek notebook with Nvidia’s RTX Max-Q graphics, but its attempt to integrate AI into gaming is a bore.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Intel Xeon W-3175X Review: Ultimate Performance at the Ultimate Price
Summary: Intel's Xeon W-3175X is a shot across AMD's bow, boasting tons of cores, lots of cache, and high clock rates. It's too bad that a sky-high price tag puts it out of reach for most enthusiasts.
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: Corsair One i160 Review: The Compact Performance PC, Refined
Summary: Corsair’s One i160 sports new top-end components and a redesigned layout. It’s expensive in every configuration option, but its performance & design impress.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Lian Li Strimer 8 Pin Review: RGB Comes to PCIe Cables
Summary: Lian Li’s Strimer lineup now includes a model for your PCIe graphics card power cables. It’s fairly affordable, but there’s no controller in the box.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Cooler Master SK630 / SK650 Keyboards Review: Low-Profile, High Portability
Summary: Cooler Master’s new SK650 and SK630 keyboards promise all of the typing comfort and RGB glamour you have on your desk at home in a lightweight form factor that fits easily in your bag.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Gigabyte Z390 Aorus Xtreme Review: On the Edge of Excellence
Summary: Gigabyte's Z390 Aorus Xtreme combines the best features of its top boards on a single product, and then adds external controllers. We take a closer look.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: AMD Radeon VII 16GB Review: A Surprise Attack on GeForce RTX 2080
Summary: AMD is first to market with a 7nm gaming GPU. The company complements its Vega 20 processor with 16GB of HBM2 on a 4,096-bit bus, packing it all into a 300W Radeon VII graphics card. Should those numbers impress you? Yeah, actually, they should.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Cooler Master Hyper 212 Black Edition and RGB Review: A Legacy for Value
Summary: We test out new swanky, upgraded versions of Cooler Master’s Hyper 212 coolers, the Hyper 212 Black Edition with a Silencio fan and the Hyper 212 RGB Black Edition.
Product_Name: Cooler Master Hyper 212 Black Edition and RGB
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Thermaltake A500TG Aluminum Case Review: Gorgeous Versatility
Summary: Want an extremely versatile PC case with a sleek and sophisticated design? Look no further than the Thermaltake A500TG Aluminum case. Just remember to bring your gold card because this premium case doesn't come cheap.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: G.Skill Trident Z Royal DDR4-3200 C14 Review: RAM Goes Luxe
Summary: We may never be royal, but we can still enjoy the luxury of gold-plated heat spreaders and crystal RGB light diffusers covering DDR4-3200 at CAS 14 timings.
Product_Name: G.Skill Trident Z Royal DDR4-3200 C14
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Razer Blade Stealth Review: Slimmer, With More Muscle
Summary: The Razer Blade Stealth is a sleek ultraportable with a nice port selection that’s excellent for productivity and even some light gaming--but it runs too hot.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Corsair SF450 Platinum SFX PSU Review: Best of the Best
Summary: The SF450 Platinum doesn't replace Corsair's 80 PLUS Gold-rated SF450, but rather improves upon it with higher efficiency and better performance.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: T-Force Night Hawk Legend RGB Review: Choosing A Motherboard For Your DDR4?
Summary: Picking memory to match a board should be easy, but what happens when you find that a specific board doesn’t work very well with your memory? We dove deeper.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Alienware Area-51m Laptop Review: Upgradeable Excellence
Summary: The Alienware Area-51m features upgradeable parts and is one of the most powerful gaming laptops that we have ever tested.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Asus ROG Maximus XI Gene Review: Dual Capacity RAM Meets DIMM.2
Summary: It’s not cheap and it’s designed for expanded onboard storage plus overclocking. But the Maximus XI Gene packs a lot of new and interesting features.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: GeIL Super Luce RGB Sync DDR4-4133 Review: Higher Voltage, Lower Price
Summary: GeIL offers low-latency DDR4-4133 for only a few more dollars than competing low-latency DDR4-3200. But is 30% faster..30% better?
Product_Name: GeIL Super Luce RGB Sync DDR4-4133
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Monoprice 33822 QHD, 144Hz Gaming Monitor Review: A 32-Inch Steal
Summary: Monoprice 33822 is a 32-inch, QHD, frameless gaming monitor with an all-aluminum chassis, 144Hz, FreeSync and a high-contrast VA panel. Recommended for budget gaming rigs.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Patriot Memory Viper V765 Keyboard Review: Bright Lights, Superior Switches
Summary: The Viper V765’s clicky switches offer a typing experience that’s second to none while its customizable RGB backlights serve a feast for the eyes.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Aorus GeForce RTX 2080 Ti Xtreme 11G Review: In A League of its Own
Summary: Gigabyte took the best and made it better with its Aorus GeForce RTX 2080 Ti Xtreme 11G. The card offers higher performance than Nvidia's Founders Edition model, RGB LED lighting, a four-year warranty, and seven display outputs.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: G-Technology G-Drive mobile Pro SSD Review: The New Thunderbolt 3 SSD Champ
Summary: G-Technology's Thunderbolt 3 and NVMe external SSD is ready to take the performance crown from Samsung's speedy X5.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: ASRock Z390 Phantom Gaming 9 Review: The 2.5GbE Value Play
Summary: The middle ground between ASRock’s Taichi and Taichi Ultimate isn’t a Taichi at all! We put its Z390 Phantom Gaming 9 to the test!
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: AOC Agon AG322QC4 Curved FreeSync 2 Gaming Monitor Review: HDR Accuracy On a Budget
Summary: Value-conscious gamers will want to check out the AOC Agon AG322QC4, a 32-inch curved VA panel with QHD resolution, FreeSync 2 and a 144Hz refresh rate. It also has accurate HDR and a wide color gamut.
Product_Name: AOC Agon AG322QC4 Curved FreeSync 2 Gaming Monitor
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: MSI Optix MAG341CQ Curved Ultra-Wide Gaming Monitor Review: A Price Breakthrough
Summary: Curved ultra-wide gaming monitors are becoming ever-more popular with gamers. Today, we’re reviewing the MSI Optix MAG341CQ, a value option with QHD resolution, FreeSync, 100Hz and a wide color gamut.
Product_Name: MSI Optix MAG341CQ Curved Ultra-Wide Gaming Monitor
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 2060 Review: Is Mainstream Ray Tracing For Real?
Summary: GeForce RTX 2060 pushes Nvidia's Turing architecture to the upper-mid-range using a familiar TU106 processor.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Team Group Delta Tuf Gaming RGB DDR4-3200: a Good Value, for Asus Boards
Summary: Team Group embraces the Asus TUF Gaming Alliance with an RGB-lighted 2x8GB DDR4-3200 CAS 16 DDR4 memory kit. How well does it compete against existing models?
Product_Name: Team Group Delta Tuf Gaming RGB DDR4-3200: a Good Value, for Asus Boards
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Asus ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2070 O8G Gaming Review: Bring Out The Big Guns
Summary: Asus' ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2070 O8G Gaming dares enthusiasts to spend a little more money on a graphics card offering lower temperatures, quieter fans, and extra features.
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2070 O8G Gaming
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: PC Power & Cooling Silencer 1050W PSU Review: Affordable Yet Powerful
Summary: The new PC Power & Cooling Silencer 1050W is based on a fresh and competent platform from High Power. Thanks to its attractive price, this model is highly competitive in a crowded market.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Low-Cost Meets Eight Cores: MSI MAG Z390 Tomahawk Review
Summary: Can a $160 motherboard support a $500 CPU? Should it?
Product_Name: Low-Cost Meets Eight Cores: MSI MAG Z390 Tomahawk Review
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Samsung 1TB 860 QVO SSD Review: QLC Comes To SATA
Summary: Samsung's new 860 QVO comes in 1TB, 2TB, and 4TB capacities with QLC flash.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Gigabyte GeForce RTX 2070 Gaming OC 8G Review: Faster Than Nvidia's FE Alternative
Summary: Gigabyte's GeForce RTX 2070 Gaming OC 8G outperforms Nvidia's Founders Edition card, and at a lower price. But it uses a higher power target to achieve superior frame rates, increasing power consumption, heat, and noise in the process.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Asus ROG Maximus XI Hero (Wi-Fi) Review: For Overclockers Only?
Summary: The ROG Maximus XI Hero targets the gaming crowd with its high price and overclocking capability, but can it match any of its rivals in value?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: HP Spectre Folio 13 Review: Leather-Clad Convertible
Summary: HP’s Spectre Folio is a daring, innovative approach to 2-in-1s, with leather, LTE capability and long battery life. But the design has some kinks to work out, and the laptop is pricey for the performance it offers.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: ASRock X399M Taichi Review: TR4 Goes Tiny
Summary: The idea of jamming a HEDT Threadripper CPU into the compact ASRock X399M Taichi seems strange. But we found value and opportunity with this mATX board.
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: Acer Predator Helios 500 (AMD Config): Ryzen & Vega Impress
Summary: What happens when you pack a second-gen Ryzen desktop CPU and Vega 56 graphics inside a mostly well-designed laptop housing?
Product_Name: Acer Predator Helios 500 (AMD Config): Ryzen & Vega Impress
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Dell G5 15 Gaming Laptop Review: A Good Starter Rig
Summary: The Dell G5 15 is a good entry-level gaming companion with upgradeable storage and memory. Just don't expect to play games at the highest settings.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: FSP Hydro PTM 650W PSU Review: Clean, Quiet Power for Mid-Range PCs
Summary: The FSP Hydro PTM with 650W capacity mostly addresses enthusiast users who need a reliable and good performance PSU, featuring a distinctive looks as well.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Thermaltake Level 20 GT RGB Review
Summary: The Thermaltake Level 20 GT RGB is a great chassis that looks as good as it performs. But the $289 (£ 227.13) price will likely be the deciding factor for most people considering this case.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: littleBits Avengers Hero Inventor Kit Review: Super-Powered STEM Fun
Summary: The littleBits Avengers Hero Inventor Kit teaches kids valuable STEM skills in an engaging way, but it's a little pricey.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Cooler Master MasterCase SL600M Review: Subtle Style, Great Cooling
Summary: Cooler Master MasterCase SL600M's quality construction and strong thermal performance more than justify its asking price.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: AMD Athlon 200GE Review: Zen and Vega Get Cheap
Summary: AMD is breathing life back into an almost 20-year-old brand with the Athlon 200GE processor armed with Radeon Vega 3 graphics.
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: Walmart’s Overpowered Gaming Laptop 17+ Review: Sam's Choice, Not Ours
Summary: The Overpowered Gaming Laptop 17+, a Walmart-exclusive gaming laptop, is carried by strong performance and a tactile keyboard but marred by excessive logos, a problematic charger and an ironically hefty price tag.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: Walmart’s Overpowered Gaming Desktop DTW3 Review: Budget for a Reason
Summary: Walmart’s Overpowered Gaming Desktop DTW3 is cheap and offers solid gaming performance, but those savings come from questionable parts, which are housed in a questionable design.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: ASRock Z390 Phantom Gaming-ITX/ac Review: ITX Excellence
Summary: ASRock’s latest Mini ITX motherboard takes on ATX rivals in features, price, performance, and efficiency. It's an exceptional compact board for an Intel build.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Adata XPG Spectrix D41 Review: RGB Value At DDR4-3600
Summary: This isn’t the best DDR4-3600 that any amount of money can buy, but it may be the best DDR4-3600 many builders can afford.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Deepcool Gamer Storm New Ark 90 Review: Design Favors Looks Over Function
Summary: Does DeepCool’s integrated-CLC case provide the performance and features to match its elegant appearance and high price?
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: Acer RG270 Gaming Monitor Review: Color Accuracy at a Budget Price
Summary: The Acer RG270 delivers solid gaming performance for a budget price.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Microsoft Surface Laptop 2 Review: Sleek New Paint, Same Old Ports
Summary: Microsoft’s Surface Laptop 2 oozes elegance, but it's only a slight upgrade over last year’s model. It has strong performance and a vivid display, but really needs new ports to get with the times and could use faster storage.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: MSI Trident X Gaming Desktop Review: Big Power, Small Package
Summary: The MSI Trident X is a powerful, compact machine that can be upgraded with standardized parts at a good price.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Thermaltake Toughpower Grand RGB 850W Gold PSU Review: Going Full RGB
Summary: Thermaltake goes full RGB again with its new Toughpower 850W unit. Will it be good enough though to fight with the RM850x and the Focus Plus Gold 850W PSUs?
Product_Name: Thermaltake Toughpower Grand RGB 850W Gold PSU
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Acer Predator X27 4K Gaming Monitor Review: Our New Addiction
Summary: The Acer Predator X27 offers state-of-the-art gaming performance with Ultra HD resolution, 144Hz, G-Sync, HDR and a 384-zone backlight capable of truly prodigious contrast.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Radeon RX 590 Review: AMD’s First 12nm GPU Hits 225W
Summary: AMD's Radeon RX 590 is based on a 12nm Polaris GPU designed to fill the void between Radeon RX 580 and Vega 56. While it certainly is faster, higher power consumption hampers the company's performance per watt ratio.

Title: Razer BlackWidow Lite Keyboard Review: Simple Looks, Great Key Feel
Summary: Light enough to carry in your bag and snappy enough for a great typing experience, the BlackWidow Lite is a great choice for business people on the go.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Corsair Vengeance 5180 Gaming PC Review: Like You Built It
Summary: The Corsair Vengeance 5180 Gaming PC is a beautiful micro-ATX machine that’s easy to upgrade but has a last-gen processor that isn’t as powerful as we would like.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Corsair H100i RGB Platinum Review: More Color, Less Cooler
Summary: The H100i RGB Platinum adds bold RGB lighting to the H100i name, but does the new hardware hold a candle to its predecessor?
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Microsoft Surface Pro 6 Review: More Power, Same Design
Summary: Microsoft’s Surface Pro 6 is still the best detachable 2-in-1 around with a beautiful display and solid battery life, but its port selection is stuck in the past.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Intel Core i9-9980XE CPU Review: Still Too Expensive
Summary: The high-end desktop hits keep on coming as Intel rolls out its 18-core, 36-thread Core i9-9980XE.
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: Team Group T-Force Delta RGB SSD Review: RGB SSD Done Right, Kinda
Summary: Team Group's T-Force Delta RGB SSD is yet another example of the newfound RGB LED brightness in the storage market.
Product_Name: Team Group T-Force Delta RGB SSD
Author: Sean Webster

Title: MSI MPG Z390 Gaming Pro Carbon Review: Core i9 Value?
Summary: Does the Wi-Fi-lacking $200 MSI MPG Z390 Gaming Pro Carbon have the guts to push our expensive i9-9900K into value territory?
Product_Name: MSI MPG Z390 Gaming Pro Carbon
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: ASRock Z390 Taichi ATX Motherboard Review: i9 With More Power
Summary: Priced between MSI and Gigabyte competitors, does ASRock’s Z390 Taichi deliver quality and features to hold the center of the Core i9-9900K-compatible market?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: ASRock X399 Fatal1ty Professional Gaming Motherboard Review: More Pro than Gaming
Summary: With aggressive style and enhanced features (including a 10Gb NIC), can the ASRock X399 Professional Gaming pull gamers into the Threadripper fold?
Product_Name: ASRock X399 Fatal1ty Professional Gaming Motherboard
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: MSI's AMD Gaming M7 Line: Refined Excellence
Summary: MSI leverages AM4's cross-compatibility to make a good design great. Today, we take the X370 and X470 MSI Gaming M7 boards, run ‘em through the gauntlet, and highlight the good and bad while highlighting why this top-tier board is good for gamers.
Product_Name: MSI's AMD Gaming M7 Line: Refined Excellence
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: HTC Vive Wireless Adapter Review: No Tether, No AMD
Summary: HTC's Vive Wireless Adapter lets you cut the tether from your VR headset, but it doesn't always provide a smooth experience.
Author: Kevin Carbotte

Title: ID-Cooling Zoomflow 240 Liquid Cooler Review: RGB Style on a Budget
Summary: The Zoomflow 240 offers up tasteful RGB lighting cues and moderate cooling performance with budget-friendly pricing.
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: ASRock Fatal1ty B450 Gaming-ITX/ac Review: Small Wonder
Summary: With all of the overclocking and less of the cost, can ASRock’s little Fatal1ty B450 Gaming-ITX/ac stand up to its X-series rivals?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: NZXT E Series 850W PSU Review: An Analog Platform With Digital Enhancements
Summary: The new E850 NZXT PSU is based on a modified (and semi-digital) version of the popular Seasonic Focus platform, offering good performance overall.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: Lenovo Yoga Book C930 Review: A New (E Ink) Page for 2-in-1s
Summary: The Lenovo Yoga Book C930 is a one-of-a-kind dual-screen convertible. Its versatility make it a great travel device, but a generations-old processor and wonky touchpad are limiting.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: Samsung Galaxy Book 2 Review: First Snapdragon 850 Device Falls Short
Summary: This Qualcomm-powered device has a gorgeous OLED screen and built-in 4G, but is it fast enough to justify the price?
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Alienware m15 (2018) Gaming Laptop Review: Leaner and Meaner
Summary: This is the company’s first truly thin gaming machine. While it has a thinner design, it still gets strong performance with an overclocked Intel Core i7-8750H and Nvidia GeForce GTX 1070 Max-Q GPU.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Extreme Laptop Review: Cool Screen, Hot Temps
Summary: The Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Extreme combines strong performance with an eye-popping display, but it gets hot and battery life could be better.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Lenovo Legion Y730 (15-inch) Gaming Laptop Review: Expensive Elegance
Summary: The Lenovo Legion Y730 is a premium, entry-level gaming notebook with solid performance, but its awkward webcam and brief battery life will give some pause.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Deepcool Gamer Storm Castle 280RGB Review: Bigger Than It Cools
Summary: A big, 280 radiator aims to provide this AIO a bit more breathing room for your CPU overclocks, but falls a bit short.
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: AMD Ryzen Threadripper 2970WX Review: 24 Cores on a Budget
Summary: The $1,300 Ryzen Threadripper 2790WX comes bristling with 24 cores and 48 threads of processing power, but is it better than the less-expensive Threadripper X-series models?
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: Corsair Crystal Series 280X RGB Review: A Worthy Micro ATX Upgrade?
Summary: What does $60 in RGB get you in an upgraded Corsair case? We check it out!
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: Supermicro C9Z390-CG-IW Review: 9900K Meets Mini-ITX
Summary: Can Super Micro pack the hot new LGA 1151 Core i9 into Mini ITX without doubling down on the “hot” part? We find out!
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Lenovo Yoga C930 Laptop Review: Closer to Perfection
Summary: Predominantly defined by its serviceable pen “garage,” the Lenovo Yoga C930 is a well rounded 2-in-1 laptop.
Author: Gabe Carey

Title: Asus ROG Strix GL12CX Gaming Desktop Review: Esports Overkill
Summary: You’ll pay a lot for the Asus ROG Strix GL12CX, but this desktop is a powerhouse gaming rig that shows games at their very best and comes with great peripherals.
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix GL12CX Gaming Desktop
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Gigabyte Z390 Designare Review: High-End Excellence
Summary: Designed for connectivity and productivity, can the inconspicuous Desginare match its flashier gaming-themed rivals in performance, overclocking, and value?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Sony G Series Professional SSD Review: Endurance Comes At A Price
Summary: Sony isn't the first name that comes to mind when we think of SSDs, but the company does have a new G Series Professional SSD on the market.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Corsair H115i RGB Platinum Review: Bigger, Bolder, Brighter...Not Best
Summary: Corsair H115i RGB Platinum brings Corsair’s iCue-controlled RGB to a 140x280mm fan layout, but can it outperform the older 120x240 model?
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Gigabyte GeForce RTX 2080 Gaming OC 8G Review: Turing Goes Semi-Passive
Summary: Gigabyte's GeForce RTX 2080 Gaming OC 8G is every bit as fast as Nvidia's Founders Edition model, plus it adds configurable lighting, semi-passive operation, and an optional four-year warranty.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Philips 436M6VBPAB Momentum 43-Inch 4K FreeSync Monitor Review: Better Than a TV
Summary: Is it a monitor or is it a TV? The Philips 436M6 blurs the lines with a 43-inch VA screen, Ultra HD resolution, FreeSync, HDR and a 1,000-nit backlight.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: Dell S2719DGF 155Hz Gaming Monitor Review: Speedy QHD
Summary: Users looking for a high-speed gaming experience should check out Dell’s new S2719DGF. It’s a 27-inch TN panel with a 155Hz overclock, FreeSync and QHD resolution.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: ASRock Z390 Taichi Ultimate Motherboard Review: All About the Networking
Summary: The Ultimate version of ASRock’s Z390 Taichi adds 10GbE without taking away any of the cheaper version’s integrated networking. Is it worth the cash?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Scythe Ninja 5 Review: Big Air On The Square
Summary: Scythe Ninja 5 – Big n’ quiet air cooling needs more breeze, if you please
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Gigabyte X399 Aorus Xtreme Review: Overclocking Without Compromise
Summary: How does AMD's top-end 2990WX perform in a full-fledged recent X399 offering? Spoiler Alert: Gigabyte learned a thing or two and the X399 Aorus Xtreme board gets it right.
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: Corsair SF600 Platinum PSU Review: Setting The SFX Performance Bar Higher
Summary: Corsair's new SF600 Platinum is notably more expensive than the older SF600 Gold. So, is the price premium worth paying?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: WD Black SN750 SSD Review: A Not so Fresh Refresh
Summary: WD's new Black SN750 offers a surprisingly good performance upgrade through firmware and software tweaks.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: HP Omen Obelisk 2018 Review: Upgrade-Ready
Summary: The HP Omen Obelisk is HP’s most upgradable PC, but it needs at least one more fan and isn’t entirely customizable.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: ASRock Z390 Extreme4 Review: 9th Gen “Core” Value?
Summary: Boasting Core i9 support at a mid-market price, could ASRock’s mid-market board be your path to performance value? Not when paired with a Core i9 CPU.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: LG 34GK950F Curved Gaming Monitor Review: 144Hz Ultrawide With HDR
Summary: LG delivers 144Hz, FreeSync 2 and HDR in the capable 34GK950F. It’s a curved ultra-wide IPS panel with 3440x1440 resolution and DCI-P3 color. With an impressive feature set, it should be on every buyer’s short list.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: EVGA SuperNOVA 650 GM PSU Review: Big Power In A Small Form Factor
Summary: The 650 GM is EVGA's highest-end SFX-based power supply. It is a based on a unique FSP platform, yielding different (but still good) performance characteristics compared to Corsair's venerable SF600.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: MSI GE75 Raider Laptop Review: Gaming Perks
Summary: MSI combines an 8th Gen Intel CPU with RTX 2080 and throws in colorful effects and a healthy amount of software. The result is a speedy, stylish machine.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: BenQ PD2700U 4K HDR Monitor Review: Pro-Level Accuracy, Attractive Price
Summary: The BenQ PD2700U delivers professional-grade performance at a reasonable price. We test out the 27-inch IPS panel with 4K/UHD resolution, HDR10 and factory-certified calibration.
Author: Christian Eberle

Title: MSI B450 Gaming Pro Carbon AC: Mixed Mid-Range Impressions
Summary: MSI’s B450 Gaming Pro Carbon AC aims to lure value builders in with its top-shelf aesthetic but charges a bit more for the opportunity.
Product_Name: MSI B450 Gaming Pro Carbon AC: Mixed Mid-Range Impressions
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: Corsair SF750 PSU Review: A Tiny Power Factory
Summary: The SF750 is the strongest SFX power supply that money can buy today, however it is among the most expensive as well. So is it worth spending so much to get it?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: LaCie Rugged RAID Pro 4TB Review: A Tough HDD Built for Speed
Summary: LaCie’s Rugged RAID Pro is a fast external HDD built to take on the elements, has an integrated UHS-II SC card reader, and comes with a data recovery protection plan.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Bitfenix Enso Mesh Review: Pretty, but Flawed
Summary: Bitfenix's Enso Mesh hits two marks with a tempered glass panel and RGB lighting, but misses a few more for its higher-than-average price.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: MSI GS75 Stealth Review: A Sleek 17-incher
Summary: The MSI GS75 Stealth is a sleek 17-inch gaming notebook with a bright screen and strong performance, but its massive touchpad can interfere with typing.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: HP Spectre x360 15 (2019) Laptop Review: An Edgier Look
Summary: The HP Spectre x360 (15-inch) is a powerful convertible laptop for creatives with impressive audio, but the display is too dim.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Vuzix Blade Smart Glasses Review: AR Fun Over Fashion
Summary: Vuzix Blade is an advanced pair of smart glasses with apps and image quality that’ll leave you impressed. However, their unflattering look, painful fit and tinted lenses means you probably won’t want to wear them all day.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: DeepCool Gamer Storm Fryzen TR4 Cooler Review: Better for Budget Builds
Summary: The beastly Ryzen Threadripper 2900WX is a powerhouse of a CPU that devours workload threads and gobs of electricity: Can the Fryzen free it from similarly enormous cooling requirements?
Product_Name: DeepCool Gamer Storm Fryzen TR4 Cooler
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Samsung 983 ZET SSD Review: Z-NAND Takes On Optane
Summary: Samsung's new Z-NAND powered 983 ZET goes toe-to-toe with Intel's Optane.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Noblechairs Hero Gaming Chair Review: Refined, But Firm
Summary: The Noblechairs Hero is an elegant gaming chair that’s easy to build, but it’s on the stiff side and costs quite a bit.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Razer Turret for Xbox One Review: King of the Couch
Summary: The Razer Turret is a great keyboard and mouse combo for Xbox One and PC, though it needs more Xbox games that support it.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: HP Spectre x360 13 (2019) Laptop Review: Best Consumer 2-in-1
Summary: HP’s Spectre x360 13-inch offers a best-in-class combination of style, portability and performance.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Intel Optane Memory H10 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: QLC Flash Meets Optane Caching
Summary: Intel's Optane Memory H10 fuses the speed of Optane with the capacity and cheap pricing of QLC flash, all on one M.2 stick.
Product_Name: Intel Optane Memory H10 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Alienware m17 Laptop Review: Hot Rod Gaming
Summary: The Alienware m17 is a strong performer with great audio and a lovely display, but it runs hot and very loud.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1650 4GB Review: This Turing Fails the Test
Summary: Nvidia's GeForce GTX 1650 serves up respectable performance at 1920x1080. However, AMD's Radeon RX 570 is faster and less expensive.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: Cougar Gemini X Case Review: Big, Expensive and Flawed
Summary: Cougar’s pricey Gemini X sports premium construction and room for two systems. But does its interesting design deliver the functionality to justify the price?
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: HP Reverb VR Headset Review: Windows Mixed Reality Never Looked So Good
Summary: HP Reverb is the best Windows Mixed Reality headset, but that may be its biggest downfall. It's impressive, but the included controllers ruin the experience.
Author: Kevin Carbotte

Title: G.Skill Ripjaws V DDR4-3200 2x16GB Kit Review: No Lights, Nice Price
Summary: If your CPU and board support DDR4-3200 XMP, G.Skill's Ripjaws V DDR4-3200 2x16GB Kit is an great value, so long as you don't need your memory to flash or blink.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Patriot Viper VPN100 NVMe SSD Review: A Tactical Upgrade
Summary: Patriot's latest SSD comes with a powerful and proven design from Phison, an impressive heatsink, and write endurance to handle any task.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: G.Skill Trident Z RGB 2x 16GB DDR4-3600 C17 Kit Review: Elusive Value
Summary: Can an RGB memory kit offer better value at DDR4-3600 CAS 17? Perhaps not in the US. But it may be tough to find this G.Skill kit in stock when you’re ready to buy.
Product_Name: G.Skill Trident Z RGB 2x 16GB DDR4-3600 C17 Kit
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Razer Seiren X Microphone Review: Compact Streamer Upgrade
Summary: For streamers who need a portable or space-saving setup, the Seiren X is a good fit, offering crystal-clear vocals. But it picks up keyboard and mouse clicks.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk

Title: Cooler Master MM830 Gaming Mouse Review: Fast, Flashy, and Flawed
Summary: Can a kind-of-crazy 24k sensor and a tiny OLED screen push Cooler Master's latest premium gaming mouse past the many competing rodents?
Author: Matthew Hanson

Title: Seagate BarraCuda 510 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Competitive Performance Meets Bad Pricing
Summary: Seagate's new BarraCuda 510 brings competitive performance, but pricing needs a makeover.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Audio-Technica AT2020USB+ Cardioid Condenser Mic Review: Versatile Performer
Summary: This is an incredible mic for relatively little outlay. Whether streaming, podcasting or recording music, it's effectively a studio mic with the ease of USB.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk

Title: SteelSeries Rival 110 Gaming Mouse Review: a Budget-Gaming Great?
Summary: SteelSeries budget-priced gaming mouse strikes a good balance between price, comfort, and good performance.
Author: Matthew Hanson

Title: Logitech G Pro X Gaming Headset Review: Luxurious Listening
Summary: Logitech’s G Pro X headset is a full package with great sound, customizable software and plenty of accessories.
Product_Name: Logitech G Pro X Gaming Headset
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Silicon Power P34A80 PCIe Gen3x4 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: TLC Performance at QLC Prices
Product_Name: Silicon Power P34A80 PCIe Gen3x4 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Ballistix Gaming Sport LT DDR4-3200 C16 Review: Value, Hold the RGB
Summary: Can Ballistix Gaming compete on performance and price in the cramped enthusiast-value memory market?
Product_Name: Ballistix Gaming Sport LT DDR4-3200 C16
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: NordVPN Review: Top-Notch Security, Spotty Connection
Summary: NordVPN is cost-efficient, providing a large number of servers and a wide array of features focused on privacy and security.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić

Title: IPVanish VPN Review: Powerful Performance, Privacy Concerns
Summary: IPVanish is an excellent VPN when it comes to speeds, connectivity and features. But there are concerns over its no-logging policy.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić

Title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Super Review: High-Res Gaming at a Premium Price
Summary: Improved yields give Nvidia an ample supply of defect-free TU104 processors with which to build its new GeForce RTX 2080 Super. The company adds Samsung's 16 Gb/s GDDR6 memory to improve performance roughly 6% compared to the older GeForce RTX 2080.
Author: Chris Angelini

Title: StrongVPN Review: Strong and Simple
Summary: StrongVPN provides all the standard privacy mechanisms and strong encryption. But details on its no-logs policy are scarce.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić

Title: Gamdias Talos P1A Review: Trendy Case With Good Performance
Summary: The Gamdias Talos P1A is a fancy case with the latest trends, like RGB and hinged tempered glass. But it lacks an intake fan filter and Type-C port.
Author: Steven Lynch

Title: Asus ROG Zenith Extreme Alpha Review: an X399 Thoroughbred
Summary: Now that Zen 2 is here, many are wondering if X399 is still worth their time. This reviewer says yes, and the Asus X399 Zenith Extreme Alpha is a prime example of why the AMD HEDT is here to stay.
Author: Jacob Terkelsen

Title: Corsair Vengeance LPX DDR4-3000 Review: 2x32GB Arrives
Summary: The only option for some buyers who need 64GB on their two-slot boards, does Corsair’s Vengeance LPX have enough performance to make them feel good about that option?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: WD Blue SN500 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Leaving SATA in the Dust (Updated)
Summary: WD's Blue SN500 brings SATA-like pricing to a speedy NVMe SSD.
Product_Name: WD Blue SN500 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Lego Hidden Side Review: Ultimate AR Toy
Summary: Lego’s Hidden Side sets pair an impressive augmented reality experience with an addictive gaming experience and fun builds.
Author: Avram Piltch

Title: Gigabyte X570 Aorus Pro Wi-Fi Review: Well-Rounded Value
Summary: With an impressive set of features, including front-and-rear Gen2 USB options and Wi-Fi 6, plus attractive looks, this $270 X570 board from Gigabyte is worthy of serious consideration.
Author: Joe Shields

Title: Deepcool Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro Review
Summary: Deepcool’s Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro lands on our test bench with an innovative leak-proof radiator design, sharp RGB lighting and a fully-functional coolant snorkel.
Product_Name: Deepcool Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro Review
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: SteelSeries Apex 7 Review: OLED for Your Keys?
Summary: SteelSeries’ Apex 7 retains the design elements we liked in the pricier Pro, along with the OLED screen. But is that enough to justify its rather high $160 asking price?
Author: Nathaniel Mott

Title: ASRock X570 Phantom Gaming-ITX/TB3 Review: Full-Featured, Compact
Summary: ASRock's Phantom Gaming-ITX/TB3 includes a robust 10 Phase VRM, 7.1 channel Realtek ALC 1220 audio, integrated Wi-Fi 6 abilities, and one of the highest memory speed support listings we’ve seen, at DDR4 4533+(OC).
Author: Joe Shields

Title: SteelSeries Apex Pro Mechanical Gaming Keyboard Review: Truly Personal
Summary: The SteelSeries Apex Pro RGB mechanical gaming keyboard may change the way you game. But fans of tactile typing will want more from the linear switches.
Product_Name: SteelSeries Apex Pro Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: MSI GE65 Raider Review: Laptop Gaming Done Right
Summary: The MSI GE65 Raider gaming laptop gets you the framerates and productivity power expected of more expensive machines.
Author: Scharon Harding

Title: Corsair iCUE 220T RGB Airflow Chassis Review: Compact ATX Performer
Summary: Corsair’s iCUE 220T RGB Airflow chassis, is an intriguing reimagining of what is perhaps the most empirically important piece of case design out there: good airflow.
Author: Zak Storey

Title: SteelSeries Arctis 1 Gaming Headset Review: Comfortable, Breathable
Summary: There's a great package crammed into the SteelSeries Arctis 1, considering its budget price. But there are better-sounding headsets that are similarly priced.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk

Title: Arctic Freezer 34 Esports Duo Cooler Review: A Twin-Fan Triple Threat
Summary: Arctic’s new esports-themed air cooler boasts aggressive styling, disruptive pricing and impressive performance.
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Audio-Technica ATH-G1 Gaming Headset Review: Understated and Powerful
Summary: Audio-Technica shows off excellent sound quality with the premium-priced ATH-G1 gaming headset and achieves it with a distinctive, powerful tone.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk

Title: CLX Ra Review: Refined Ryzen Power
Summary: CLX harnesses the power of Ryzen with its Ra desktop. It’s a splashing, expertly assembled rig that’s able to handle most high-end tasks with ease.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: Cougar Helor 360 Review: Big AIO Cooling With Bigger ARGB Splash
Summary: An aggressively Illuminated aRGB alternative to better-known all-in-ones, does Cougar’s Helor 360 CPU cooler have the performance and price to create its own niche?
Author: Garrett Carver

Title: Adata Ultimate SU750 SATA SSD Review: Not Quite The Ultimate SSD
Summary: Adata’s Ultimate SU750 has decent performance for a SATA drive, but it slurps power and competitors give you a lot more for the same price.
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Asus X570 ROG Crosshair VIII Hero Wi-Fi Review: Mid-Range Menagerie
Summary: Asus’s sub-$400 X570 ROG motherboard is well worth considering thanks to its plethora of speedy USB, SATA, and other features, as well as robust cooling and solid performance.
Product_Name: Asus X570 ROG Crosshair VIII Hero Wi-Fi
Author: Joe Shields

Title: Mushkin Pilot-E M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Taking Flight
Summary: Mushkin's new high-end M.2 drive boasts high endurance, fast performance and 256-bit AES encryption. Can it best the plethora of similarly equipped competition?
Author: Sean Webster

Title: Alienware m15 R2 Review: Spartan Spaceship
Summary: The Alienware m15 R2 looks nice and offers strong performance, but the RAM is soldered down and the display could be a little brighter.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: HyperX Predator DDR4-2666 16GB Dual-Channel Kit Review: Speedy and Safe
Summary: Intel’s unwillingness to budge on higher-speed memory has us searching for new recommendations for H370 and B360 platforms. Is this HyperX the kit to get?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: HyperX Cloud Mix Rose Gold Edition Review: Bluetooth Headset's New Look
Summary: The HyperX Cloud Mix headset delivers with excellent sound quality, comfort, understated design, premium build quality and Bluetooth capabilities, but its high price tag is a turn off.
Product_Name: HyperX Cloud Mix Rose Gold Edition
Author: Nate Rand

Title: Corsair Vengeance LPX 2x8GB DDR4-2666 Kit Review: Attainable Unobtainium
Summary: Corsair’s 16GB DDR4-2666 kit aims to conquer all competitors by doubling the number of ranks per DIMM. Here’s how!
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Fractal Design Ion SFX Gold 650W Power Supply Review
Summary: Great performance, highly modular.
Product_Name: Fractal Design Ion SFX Gold 650W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos

Title: G.Skill Ripjaws V DDR4-2666 16GB Review: V for Value?
Summary: Our search for the ultimate, modern DDR4-2666 kit continues with G.Skill’s moderately-priced CAS 15 kit. Does cheaper mean better?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Google Pixelbook Go Review: A Playful Clamshell
Summary: The Google Pixelbook Go is a playful Chromebook with long battery life, but it’s not affordable above the base model and the touchpad can be fussy.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Patriot Viper RGB DDR4-2666 2x8GB Kit Review: A Splash Of Color For B360 and H370
Summary: Our fourth set of memory for Intel’s locked mainstream platforms has RGB: Is the price still right?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Ballistix Sport LT 16GB DDR4-2666 Review: Compatibility King?
Summary: Ballistix Gaming offers the greatest number of compatibility modes and a low price, but does it offer enough performance to make it a solid value?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom

Title: Razer Blade Pro 17 Review: Refined RTX
Summary: Razer’s revamped Blade Pro 17 brings RTX graphics and and a smaller footprint, but there’s only one screen option, and it isn’t great.
Author: Matt Safford

Title: AMD Ryzen 9 3900 Review: a Taste of Eco Mode
Summary: Pre-built systems just took a big step forward.
Author: Paul Alcorn

Title: Microsoft Surface Laptop 3 (15-inch) Review: AMD Inside
Summary: The Microsoft Surface Laptop 3 (15-inch) is an attractive, thin 15-inch notebook -- and it finally has USB Type-C. But what about performance and battery life?
Author: Andrew E. Freedman

Title: Title
Summary: Summary
Author: Author
column13: Verdict

Title: Gigabyte Aero 17 HDR XB (Intel 10th Gen) Review: Balanced Performance
Summary: New CPU and graphics silicon meets an AMOLED display.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Gigabyte’s Aero 17 HDR XB balances content creation and gaming needs while looking like a trim workstation. Its screen, battery life, and performance are quite good. Just know that the webcam is stuck awkwardly above the keyboard.
column14: Powerful new hardware in a slim package
column15: Powerful new hardware in a slim package

Title: MSI Clutch GM30 Gaming Mouse Review: Comfy RGB Pointer
Summary: Your palm will thank you for using the MSI Clutch GM30.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The MSI Clutch GM30 prioritizes comfort with a design that caters to the palms and fingers. Its reliable sensor has room to grow specs-wise but is aided by a gamer-friendly button layout. However, MSI really needs to fix the companion app.

Title: JBL Quantum One Gaming Headset Review: Attempting a Quantum Leap
Summary: Feature-rich, but 3D audio head tracking disappoints.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: JBL’s first flagship gaming headset is comfy and feature-rich, but its head tracking doesn’t earn the $300 price tag.

Title: PNY XLR8 2x16GB DDR4-3200 Review: A Really Big Deal?
Summary: This PNY XLR8 kit is a steal if you get it directly from PNY.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: When ordered from the PNY store, PNY’s XL8R 32GB dual-channel kit is one of the most price-competitive in its class. But value-seekers shopping at mainstream sellers will be far less enthused.

Title: Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro Review: Wireless FPS Upgraded
Summary: A solid upgrade over the non-Pro version.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: The Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro is a real front-runner in the wireless FPS mouse race, but its shape will turn off some gamers.

Title: Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 Review: AMD Ryzen 9 4900HS Tested
Summary: One of the best AMD-based laptops we’ve ever seen.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 and its AMD Ryzen 4900HS CPU deliver epic battery life and strong performance in a light and attractive package.

Title: ASRock RX 5500 XT Phantom Gaming D Review: Inexpensive, Well-performing
Summary: Inexpensive, cool running and performs well
Product_Name: ASRock RX 5500 XT Phantom Gaming D
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The ASRock RX 5500 XT Phantom Gaming D averaged over 60 fps at 1080p ultra and 102 fps at 1080p medium. Priced lower than most RX 5500 XTs, the card offers great value among its peers and does so with good performance and relatively quiet operation.

Title: Razer Basilisk X HyperSpeed Wireless Gaming Mouse Review: Value Performer
Summary: The Razer Basilisk X HyperSpeed punches above its weight class.
Product_Name: Razer Basilisk X HyperSpeed Wireless Gaming Mouse
Author: Nathaniel Mott
column13: The Basilisk X HyperSpeed proves specs don’t tell the full story by offering nigh identical performance to newer--and more expensive--models.

Title: Dell XPS 13 (9300) Review: More Screen, Less Bezels
Summary: Long battery life meets sleek design in the Dell XPS 13 (9300).
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: With over 12 hours of battery life, more vertical screen real estate and an attractive design, the Dell XPS 13 (9300) is one of the best clamshells you can buy.

Title: Gigabyte TRX40 Aorus Xtreme Review: Battle For Threadripper Supremacy
Summary: A multi-GPU monster board
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The TRX40 Aorus Xtreme is likely the best board available to HEDT users who want a superior networking solution and have little care for manual CPU overclocking.
column14: Ideal slot layout for multiple graphics cards
column15: Ideal slot layout for multiple graphics cards

Title: Sabrent Rocket NVMe 4.0 M.2 SSD Review: A High-Performance Value
Summary: Sabrent’s Rocket NVMe 4.0 offers unparalleled speed and endurance for the price.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Sabrent’s Rocket NVMe 4.0 is the total package. It is fast, efficient, and enduring, plus it looks great and is priced well.

Title: BenQ EW3280U Review: 4K HDR WIth Superb Color and USB-C
Summary: 4K and extended color in a 32-inch IPS screen with Adaptive-Sync.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: At the BenQ EW3280U’s $800 price point, you’ll only get a better gaming monitor if you go smaller. This 32-incher is bright and colorful and is only limited by its IPS-level contrast. HDRi modes are effective at deepening SDR picture images. Ultimately, the EW3280U provides a great balance of performance for gaming, entertainment and workday tasks.

Title: Cougar Aqua 240 Review: Affordable Performance
Summary: Cougar’s Aqua 240 stalks its prey atop our performance 240 AIO charts.
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: The Cougar Aqua 240 stands up well against the best 240mm AIOs we’ve tested, while boasting a budget-friendly $85 price and RGB accent lighting. Just know you’ll need to rely on your motherboard for fan and pump controls.

Title: GeIL Evo Spear Phantom Gaming DDR4-3200 Review: Cheap AMD Performance
Summary: Low price meets acceptable performance
Product_Name: GeIL Evo Spear Phantom Gaming DDR4-3200
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: We’re split over whether a $4 price difference is enough to justify buying the slowest DDR4-3200 kit we’ve tested in recent memory, but those performance losses are typically small enough that we wouldn’t criticize those who do.

Title: Asus ROG Zenith II Extreme Alpha Review: More Overkill?
Summary: Still Premium, Still Pricey
Product_Name: Asus ROG Zenith II Extreme Alpha
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: With the best overclocking features in its price class, the ROG Zenith II Extreme Alpha earns our vote for Threadripper-based extreme performance builds.
column14: 28% greater maximum power output than its predecessor
column15: 28% greater maximum power output than its predecessor

Title: Razer Basilisk V2 Gaming Mouse Review: A Better DeathAdder
Summary: Razer Basilisk V2 does everything well--for a price.
Author: Nathaniel Mott
column13: Razer brought the Basilisk into 2020 in the best possible way, thanks to a bevy of new features packed into an ergonomic design at a reasonable price considering what you get.

Title: be quiet! Straight Power 11 550W Platinum Power Supply Review
Summary: The new Straight Power 11 model with 550W max power is now certified as 80 PLUS Platinum and uses a more capable platform.
Product_Name: be quiet! Straight Power 11 550W Platinum Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Straight Power 11 Platinum model with 550W max power is silent, achieves satisfactory overall performance and uses quality parts. The performance difference with the previous model is small, though.

Title: HP V6 2x8GB DDR4-3200 Review: Old Hand Or New Player?
Summary: HP-branded SSDs have often been competitive. Buy what about HP memory?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Though its five-year warranty is probably long enough for most buyers, HP’s V6 DDR4-3200 isn’t priced competitively to overtake better-known rivals.

Title: Apple MacBook Air (2020) Review: Return to Form
Summary: The new Apple MacBook Air hias an excellent keyboard and great speakers, but isn’t as powerful as Windows rivals.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: Apple’s MacBook is a return to form as a chic, premium laptop for everyday use with great speakers and an excellent set of speakers, though it falls behind Windows PCs in performance.

Title: Intel NUC 9 Extreme Kit (Ghost Canyon) Review: In Its Compute Element
Summary: A pricey barebones PC with a new form factor
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Intel NUC 9 Extreme Kit (Ghost Canyon) is a pricey barebones PC that fits a discrete GPU. The Compute Element with mobile Intel CPU makes for an exciting new form factor, though.

Title: Deepcool Assassin III Review: Slaying the Competition
Summary: A thermal Assassin for enthusiast-level CPUs
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: The Deepcool Gamer Storm Assassin III should be on every enthusiast and HEDT system builder’s colling short list. With seven copper heatpipes and twin 140mm cooling fans, it provides excellent thermal performance at a competitive price of $90.

Title: Acer ConceptD CP7271K Review: A Do-Everything 4K Monitor
Summary: A 27-incher that checks off both professional creatives’ and gamers' boxes.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: For both professional use and gaming performance the 27-inch Acer ConceptD CP7271K 4K monitor delivers. With the accuracy creatives need and features even gamers crave, it delivers a unique combination of capabilities you won’t find anywhere else.

Title: HyperX Cloud Flight S Wireless Headset Review: A High Price for Qi Charging
Summary: Solid cans with nifty features, but is it worth the price?
Product_Name: HyperX Cloud Flight S Wireless Headset
Author: Nate Rand
column13: Attractive, lightweight and comfortable, this headset delivers what Cloud fans love and throws in convenience in the form of its smartly designed controls and Qi wireless charging. There are, however, some tradeoffs in features and issues with the beta software that make its $159.99 price tag a debatable value versus other products in the same lineup.

Title: Seagate IronWolf 110 SATA SSD Review: Expensive, but Enduring
Summary: Seagate’s IronWolf 110 is tweaked for NAS deployments.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: If you’re in search of a new SSD to add to your NAS, Seagate’s IronWolf 110 is a solid pick. It's an expensive beast focused on reliability, with two years of data recovery service included.

Title: Corsair 275R Airflow Review: Impressive Performance, Outlandish Style
Summary: At just $80 / £68 the Corsair 275R Airflow packs impressive performance into an efficient internal layout.
Author: Zak Storey
column13: With impressive performance and a good internal layout, plus a low price, the only thing that lets the Cardbide 275R Airflow down is its dated cable management.

Title: Supermicro C9X299-PG300F Review: a Workstation Board for Gamers
Summary: Is this “professional gaming” board a good value?
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: If you're looking for an Intel-based 10Gb workstation board with few frills, Supermicro’s C9X299-PG300F is worth considering. But the UEFI experience is rough around the edges, and overclockers might find more success with other brands.

Title: OLOy WarHawk RGB 2x32GB DDR4-3200 Review: Lower-Priced 64GB Performance
Summary: Finding Value In 2x32GB
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Oloy’s WarHawk RGB(MD4U323216DEDA) offers solid value to buyers of 64GB dual-channel kits, though those who hate RGB, have space restrictions, or worry about extended warranties might want to look to alternatives.
column14: Popular data rate for performance enthusiasts
column15: Popular data rate for performance enthusiasts

Title: HTC Vive Cosmos Elite VR Headset Review: External Tracking Faceplate Delivers
Summary: External tracking is everything the Cosmos needed.
Product_Name: HTC Vive Cosmos Elite VR Headset
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: The Cosmos Elite with the External Tracking Faceplate gives you everything you need in a VR headset, but the price makes it a tough buy against the current competition.

Title: Asus ROG String 750W Power Supply Review
Summary: Lead Text
Product_Name: Asus ROG String 750W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Asus ROG Strix 750W is dead silent and achieves high performance, but it is expensive.

Title: Arctic Z1 Pro and Z1-3D Monitor Arms Review: Added Flexibility
Summary: The Z1 Pro and Z1-3D will bring more options to the table than your monitor's factory stand.
Product_Name: Arctic Z1 Pro and Z1-3D Monitor Arms
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: If you want more flexibility and options than those provided by your monitor’s factory stand, Arctic's Z1 Pro and Z1-3D monitor arms have first-rate build quality and versatility and are reasonably priced. With a large range of adjustments and overbuilt components you can be sure your display isn’t going anywhere.

Title: Glorious Model D Gaming Mouse Review: Ultralight FPS Pointer
Summary: Does lighter = better in a gaming mouse?
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: The Model D is great for anyone interested in competitive shooters and battle royales. But its software needs to be fixed.

Title: HTC Vive Cosmos VR Headset Review: Solid Upgrade
Summary: The HTC Vive Cosmos is a great VR headset held back by bad controller ergonomics. It's comfort and lack of base stations makes it a good upgrade from the Vive.
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: The HTC Vive Cosmos is a great VR headset, but it's held back by poor controller ergonomics. Still, with a comfortable fit and the elimination of base stations, it's a solid replacement for the original HTC Vive.

Title: Asus ROG Strix RX 5500 XT O8G Gaming Review: Premium Card, but Worth the Price?
Summary: Premium features for a premium price
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix RX 5500 XT O8G Gaming
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Asus ROG Strix RX 5500 XT O8G Gaming averaged over 60 fps at 1080p ultra and 1440p medium settings. Priced a bit higher than other RX 5500 XTs, the premium features and superior cooling make this a viable option at the $230 price point.

Title: Cooler Master MH670 Gaming Headset Review: Wireless or Wired, Always Tasteful
Summary: The MH670 is a gaming headset you can invite anywhere.
Author: Nate Rand
column13: The MH670 is a lightweight, well-built looker that won’t be out of place at home or the office. While it could stand to be a tad louder, the MH670’s audio is extremely crisp and clean, and it’s mic is a step up from many similarly priced cans. At $119.99, the MH670 is very competitively priced.

Title: Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro 2x 32GB DDR4-3200 Review: 64GB In the Middle
Summary: Can Corsair’s latest Vengeance kit compete on price and performance?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Corsair’s Vengeance RGB Pro 2x 32GB DDR4-3200 comes at a low-enough price to make it worth considering against its better-specified rival. Budget and personal preference will probably dictate your decision.
column14: Available both in RGB (Pro) and non-RGB (LPX) versions
column15: Available both in RGB (Pro) and non-RGB (LPX) versions

Title: Team Group MP33 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: NVMe performance at SATA prices
Summary: Team Group’s MP33 offers up speedy performance and efficiency
Product_Name: Team Group MP33 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: If you’re on a tight budget, Team Group’s MP33 is a great option to help you reach NVMe performance on the cheap.

Title: HyperX Alloy Origins Mechanical Gaming Keyboard Review: Slick Simplicity
Summary: HyperX’s Alloy Origins mechanical gaming keyboard sports in-house switches, but what makes it great is a fine-tuning of the basics and excellent aesthetics.
Product_Name: HyperX Alloy Origins Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
Author: Matt Safford
column13: HyperX’s $110 Alloy Origins is a well-designed, colorful and compact mechanical keyboard that’s good for those who want a quality product but also want to skip the fuss and just get down to gaming.

Title: EVGA GeForce RTX 2060 KO Ultra Gaming Review: Winner by Decision
Summary: This EVGA card is the least-expensive RTX 2060, but is it a knockout?
Product_Name: EVGA GeForce RTX 2060 KO Ultra Gaming
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The EVGA RTX 2060 KO Ultra Gaming performed well in our testing, averaging over 60 fps at 1080p ultra and 1440p medium settings. In the $300 price bracket, this KO card is a winner, but it's louder than competing 2060s.
column14: Similar performance as higher specced RX 5600 XT
column15: Similar performance as higher specced RX 5600 XT

Title: Lian Li Strimer Plus Review: RGB Power Supply Cables Go 2.0
Summary: “I like the pretty lights.”
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Lian Li’s updated Strimer Plus sports improved lighting and build quality and a better controller box. It’s one of the most striking RGB products you can install in your PC.

Title: NZXT H1 Review: SFF Excellence, PSU and AIO Included
Summary: NZXT’s H1 is ready for powerful hardware inside its itty-bitty build space.
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: Simplistic, monolithic design and the capability to spec out an surprisingly powerful PC (gaming, workstation or otherwise) makes the NZXT H1 a solid choice for someone seeking full desktop potential with a very modest footprint.

Title: be quiet! Shadow Rock 3 Review: Quiet Cooling on a Budget
Summary: Out of the Shadows and atop the apex: a new mid-size cooling performer arrives from be quiet!
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: The budget-friendly Shadow Rock 3 brings decent memory clearance and excellent thermal performance to midsize CPU cooling from be quite! Available now for $50, it’s hard to beat the combination of handsome looks and performance value.

Title: Thermaltake ToughRAM DDR4-4400 Review: RGB Light Or Silver & White?
Summary: Two different DDR4-4400 kits top Thermaltake’s ToughRAM lineup: Are either of these right for you?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: While Thermaltake’s ToughRAM appears to be the best-value RGB choice at DDR4-4400, a few AMD-specific cons indicate that it’s probably best suited to ecompetitive overclockers or Intel-based systems.

Title: OLOy Owl 2x 8GB DDR4-3200 Review: Performance Meets Value?
Summary: Are price and performance good enough to make this value kit stand out?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: This kit could have won us over during holiday discounts. But current pricing is too similar to competing brands to set OLOy’s Owl DDR4-3200 C16 apart.

Title: Valve Index VR Headset and Controllers Review: A New Champion
Product_Name: Valve Index VR Headset and Controllers
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: The Valve Index headset offers excellent visuals, best-in-class tracking and top-quality build, and its Index controllers are unquestionably the best solution for interacting with virtual worlds.
column14: RGB subpixel array eliminates screen-door effect
column15: RGB subpixel array eliminates screen-door effect

Title: Corsair Vengeance 6182 Review: All-AMD Prebuilt
Summary: Does this AMD-based build take the game to Intel and Nvidia?
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Corsair Vengeance 6182 Gaming PC is an all-AMD machine with standardized parts, though the company makes some more powerful options for less money.

Title: Asus ROG Strix 650W Power Supply Review
Summary: If you are prepared to invest a notable amount, then the Asus ROG Strix 650 is a fine PSU. Nonetheless, you can find more affordable models offering the same high performance and silent operation.
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix 650W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The ROG Strix has high performance and silent operation, but it is notably more expensive than the competition.

Title: Gigabyte RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G Review: Priced Right, Performs Well
Summary: This RX 5600 XT is inexpensive, quiet, and performs well: Can we ask for more?
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Gigabyte RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G performed well, delivering over 60+ fps at 1080p using ultra settings, and it's capable of 1440p gaming with medium to high settings. This is a good card in the $300 price bracket.

Title: AMD 64-Core Threadripper 3990X Review: Battle of the Flagships
Summary: The core wars rage on.
Author: Paul Alcorn
column13: The 64-core 128-thread Threadripper 3990X is a highly-specialized processor that provides incredible performance in a narrow cross-section of workloads, but at a very attractive price point given its capabilities.

Title: Razer Viper Mini Gaming Mouse Review: Small but Feisty
Summary: The Viper Mini is a lightweight FPS weapon.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Small and (nearly) ambidextrous, the Viper Mini is for FPS players looking for a lightweight clicker with a subdued gaming aesthetic.

Title: MSI Prestige 14 Review: Think Pink
Summary: The MSI Prestige 14 is a slim laptop with discrete graphics and above-average battery life. Oh, and it’s pink.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The MSI Prestige 14 is a slim laptop with discrete graphics and above-average battery life, but the keyboard gets warm when the computer is under load and the display needs to be brighter. And yes, it comes in pink.

Title: HyperX Pulsefire Raid Gaming Mouse Review: Middling Child
Summary: HyperX’s Pulsefire Raid is an exercise in compromise.
Author: Nathaniel Mott
column13: The HyperX Pulsefire Raid has a bounty of customization options and lightweight construction, but middling durability and subpar software are compromises that limit its appeal.
column14: 11 programmable buttons offer plenty of flexibility
column15: 11 programmable buttons offer plenty of flexibility

Title: Aorus RX 5700 XT 8G Review: As Fast as XT can Be?
Summary: The best Navi card for 1440p?
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Aorus RX 5700 XT 8G is a great performer at 1440p with ultra settings. And with some tweaking, it’s 4K UHD/60 capable. But it's pricier than similarly performing cards.

Title: G.Skill TridentZ Neo 2x32GB DDR4-3200 C16 Review: Dense Modules Get Faster
Summary: Will these higher-capacity DIMMs finally catch up to their mainstream (2x16GB) counterparts?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Though expensive, the enhanced performance should put G.Skill’s Trident Z Neo 2x 32GB DDR4-3200 kit into nearly any compact, memory-hungry prosumer PC.

Title: Adata XPG Summoner Gaming Keyboard Review: Soft, but no Software
Summary: Can a wrist rest and volume wheel help the Summoner stand out?
Author: Matt Safford
column13: XPG’s Summoner features a comfortable wrist rest and a handy volume knob. But a lack of control software and a fairly high price for what you get means you may want to seek alternative options.
column14: Available with three different Cherry MX switches
column15: Available with three different Cherry MX switches

Title: Lian Li Lancool II Review: Impressive Value and Flexibility
Summary: A fantastic budget chassis for tricked-out AIO builds.
Author: Zak Storey
column13: The Lancool II packs in so much for such a low price, it’s easy to recommend--especially when you consider its flexibility.

Title: MSI Optix MAG161V Portable Monitor Review: Versatile, but Dim
Summary: A handy display, if you can stand its stand.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: MSI’s Optix MAG161V boasts an attractive design with impressive port and customization options. But its dim panel doesn’t deal with glare well, and its origami stand is a pain.

Title: Asus ROG Zephyrus S GX502 Review: Thin Frame, Full RTX 2070
Summary: The Asus ROG Zephyrus S GX502 has a full-sized RTX 2070 in it that offers great performance, but it can get loud under load.
Author: Imad Khan
column13: The ROG Zephyrus S GX502 packs tons of power in as tight of a 15.6” package as possible, but at the detriment of cooling efficiency.

Title: XPG Core Reactor 750W Power Supply Review
Summary: The XPG Core Reactor 750 is a high-performance PSU, compatible with the newest and toughest requirements of the ATX spec.
Product_Name: XPG Core Reactor 750W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The XPG Core Reactor 750 is a fine PSU offered at a high price, though. With the same amount, there are tough competitors.

Title: HyperX Fury 32GB DDR4-3733 Dual-Channel Kit Review: A Faster 2x 16GB Option
Summary: Is HyperX’s DDR4-3733 Fury our new dual-stick champion?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Though it offers good baseline performance, HyperX Fury DDR4-3733’s weird baseline timings beg for manual adjustments that most users are unfortunately afraid to make. If its price were lower, we might have recommended this kit for its DDR4-3600 secondary XMP.

Title: Lenovo Yoga C940 (14-inch) Review: Entertainment Powerhouse
Summary: The sound goes ‘round and ‘round.
Author: Fionna Agomuoh
column13: The Lenovo Yoga C940 delivers a stunning 4K display and a robust all-around speaker system, but the high-resolution screen eats away at battery life.

Title: Corsair Scimitar RGB Elite Gaming Mouse Review: a MOBA/MMO Weapon
Summary: Corsair's latest Scimitar is a well-built mouse with a targeted use case.
Product_Name: Corsair Scimitar RGB Elite Gaming Mouse
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Solidly built and finished to a very high standard for the price, the new Scimitar Elite RGB offers a comfortable MOBA/MMO mouse with a lot of macro buttons. It won’t translate well to other genres, though.

Title: Asus ROG Strix RX 5600 XT O6G Gaming Review: Solid but Expensive
Summary: Do unique fan and RGB features make this card worth its high price?
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix RX 5600 XT O6G Gaming
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Asus ROG Strix RX 5600 XT O6G Gaming performs well, delivering 60+ fps at 1080p using ultra settings, and is capable of 1440p gaming at reduced settings. But compared to the lower-priced Sapphire Pulse, it’s slower and costs significantly more.

Title: EVGA Nu Audio Pro Review: Who Needs a Sound Card in 2020?
Summary: Best for premium set-ups.
Author: Niels Broekhuijsen
column13: The EVGA Nu Audio Pro is an excellent sound card but is best used with a high-end audio system. You’ll need expensive equipment to notice the most impactful difference.

Title: XPG Core Reactor 850W Power Supply Review
Summary: The XPG Core Reactor with 850W max power offers good performance, and its build quality is high. Nonetheless, the high price does not help its competitiveness.
Product_Name: XPG Core Reactor 850W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: An expensive but good power supply, the XPG Core Reactor 850W has high efficiency even under very-light loads, and support for alternative sleep mode.

Title: Patriot Viper VPR100 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Enduring RGB
Summary: Patriot’s Viper VPR100 boasts impressive style, speed, and endurance.
Product_Name: Patriot Viper VPR100 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Patriot’s Viper VPR100 is a flashy RGB M.2 SSD that delivers a good mix of performance and endurance in an attractive RGB package. For most gamers and enthusiasts, it's easy to recommend if you like its looks.

Title: MSI MPG X570 Gaming Plus Review: Affordable Basics
Summary: The best cheap X570 option we’ve tested yet.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: If motherboard sufficiency is all you need for your AMD Ryzen 3000 processor, the MPG X570 Gaming Plus gets you that -- and a bit more -- at an ultra-low price.
column14: Adequate voltage regulator for Ryzen 3000 range
column15: Adequate voltage regulator for Ryzen 3000 range

Title: Fractal Design Define 7 Chassis Review: Versatility and Refinement
Summary: Fractal Design Define 7 combines a striking aesthetic design with a bevy of convenient build features and impressive performance.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: For enthusiasts looking for an extremely versatile chassis with a dual-layout interior, the Fractal Design Define 7 is a feature packed case with outstanding thermal and acoustic performance.

Title: Zotac GTX 1660 AMP Review: Quiet but Pricey
Summary: A compact 1080p contender
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Zotac GTX 1660 is a 1080p-capable card able to average 60 fps or more across most titles tested. The card is SFF-friendly and quiet under load but, the price is a bit high.

Title: be quiet! Pure Base 500 Review: Clean Lines, Easy Build
Summary: A good option for novice builders and those who don’t care about RGB
Author: Zak Storey
column13: The Pure Base 500, is a good-looking, easy-to-build-in case with OK cooling potential--if configured correctly.

Title: BenQ Zowie XL2411P Gaming Monitor Review: 144Hz but no Adaptive-Sync
Summary: The XL2411P delivers 144Hz and motion blur reduction in a solidly built chassis at a low price. A TN panel at 1080p promises responsive gameplay and fast frame rates.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: The BenQ Zowie XL2411P lacks FreeSync or G-Sync but delivers solid performance with blur reduction up to its 144Hz refresh rate. A few tweaks make color very accurate, and its image looks well-saturated with smooth motion resolution. It’s a decent value.

Title: SK Hynix Gold S31 SATA SSD Review: SK Hynix Barrels Into US Market
Summary: SK Hynix barrels into the U.S. SSD market
Product_Name: SK Hynix Gold S31 SATA SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: SK Hynix’s Gold S31 is a top SATA SSD pick. With performance figures of up to 560MBps, it trades blows with some of the best and is competitively priced.

Title: Silicon Power P34A60 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Mid-Range Performance at Rock-Bottom Pricing
Summary: "Cheap and good enough" wins again
Product_Name: Silicon Power P34A60 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: If you're searching for an inexpensive NVMe SSD, the P34A60 puts up a solid fight against the Intel 660p and Crucial P1. For the price, it’s hard to pass up.

Title: Asus ROG Strix X299-E Gaming II Review: Adding Polish for 10th Gen Core
Summary: Now with 10th Gen support, does the latest rendition rise to the occasion?
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix X299-E Gaming II
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: This board is a clear step forward for Asus compared to their last-gen design. However, given the price tag, unless this board is being pushed to the limit, there are better equipped or cheaper boards available which leave this shy from an editor’s choice.

Title: Orange Pi 4B Review: Raspberry Pi Competitor Has Built-in A.I.
Summary: Does the Orange Pi 4B offer a real alternative to the Raspberry Pi 4 range?
Author: Gareth Halfacree
column13: It’ll cost you more than a Raspberry Pi 4, but the Orange Pi 4B offers a range of advantages - if you can wait for more stable software builds, that is.

Title: AMD Radeon RX 5600 XT Review: Look out, RTX 2060
Summary: 1660 Ti-like pricing and better-than-2060 performance!
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The AMD RX 5600 XT 6GB is a great performer at 1080p with ultra settings and is plenty capable at 1440p using medium settings. This overclocked Sapphire model beat out the RTX 2060 while costing less and uses less power. It’s a tough card to beat at its $300 price point.

Title: WD Red SA500 Review: 4TB of SSD Storage for Your NAS
Summary: Big bulky SSDs are headed to a NAS near you
Author: Sean Webster
column13: WD’s Red SA500 NAS SSD is a direct response to Seagate’s IronWolf 110, but with its lower cost-per-GB, it is a much better value for those who don’t need extreme write endurance. WD’s Red SA500 is robust enough for most users and is significantly faster than any HDD.

Title: SteelSeries Rival 3 Gaming Mouse Review: Entry-Level Without (Much) Compromise
Summary: With good performance for just $30, the Rival 3 is a highly recommended budget mouse.
Author: Nathaniel Mott
column13: If you're willing to overlook a less-than-stellar cable, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better entry-level gaming mouse than the SteelSeries Rival 3.

Title: Alpaca Hot Dox Complete Kit Review: Easy DIY Mechanical Keyboard
Summary: The Hot Dox is easy to build, but fully leveraging the open-source software will take more work.
Author: Nate Rand
column13: Alpaca’s Hot Dox mechanical keyboard kit is remarkable in its simplicity, featuring everything required to build a functioning keyboard without soldering. Almost anyone can build it in an hour or less, but navigating the software is a different story.
column14: Fun, easy build process with no soldering required
column15: Fun, easy build process with no soldering required

Title: NZXT Kraken Z73 Review: Pretty, Pricey Performance
Summary: It’s a strong performer with a pretty LCD face. But this cooler will leave a “kraken” your wallet.
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: Dressed to impress in glitzy formal wear, the NZXT Kraken Z73 brings real-time system control, UI integration and hardcore CPU liquid cooling to those with deep pockets and high expectations.
column14: Beautiful, multi-option LCD pump face displays selected data in real-time
column15: Beautiful, multi-option LCD pump face displays selected data in real-time

Title: Gigabyte RX 5700 XT Gaming OC 8G Review: Right Price, Solid Performance
Summary: Gigabyte's take on the RX 5700 XT is affordable, with quiet cooling.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Gigabyte RX 5700 XT Gaming OC 8G performed well, running a few fps behind higher clocked cards while the Windforce 3X cooler kept thermals in control. Priced at $400, the bang for your buck is strong here.

Title: Samsung T7 Touch Portable SSD Review: Sleek, Secure Pocketable Storage
Summary: Samsung's T7 Touch portable SSD lets you unlock your data with a swipe of your finger.
Author: Sean Webster
