column13: Lexar’s SL100 Pro packs NVMe goodness into a sleek and stylish portable package. With speeds of up to 950/900 MBps read/write, it's capable of 4K media editing and most other tasks. But write speeds can degrade to 180 MBps during large transfers. Considering its price is about double the SATA-based competition, most users are better off seeking alternatives.

Title: G.Skill KM360 Mechanical Keyboard Review: Comfy Budget Typer
Summary: The G.Skill KM360 mechanical keyboard is pleasant to type on and just $50. But it cuts some design corners to hit that price.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The G.Skill KM360 is pleasant to type on with an even more pleasing price tag. But it cuts some design corners to get there.

Title: Corsair Hydro X Series Watercooling Kit Review: a Serious Custom Cooling Contender
Summary: Corsair sets sail into the realm of custom watercooling with a full suite of products under the Hydro X brand.
Product_Name: Corsair Hydro X Series Watercooling Kit
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: Corsair provides impressively competitive custom watercooling components and a new customization website to help you configure your next cooling loop. The prices of various parts can add up fast, but that's true of any custom setup.

Title: Fractal Design ION+ 560P Power Supply Review: As Quiet As It Gets
Summary: The Fractal Design Ion+ 560P is dead silent and achieves good performance in all areas. If 560W covers your needs, this should be near the top of your shopping list.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Fractal Design Ion+ 560P is dead silent and achieves good performance overall, but competitors offer better efficiency.

Title: Gigabyte Aero 17 HDR XA Gaming Laptop Review: Slim and Bright
Summary: The Gigabyte Aero 17 HDR has a great display and offers solid performance, but its AI software confuses and it has a webcam placed in a spot that makes it unusable.
Product_Name: Gigabyte Aero 17 HDR XA Gaming Laptop
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Gigabyte Aero 17 HDR has a great display and offers solid performance, but its AI software confuses and it has a webcam placed in a spot that makes it unusable.

Title: HyperX Cloud Orbit S Gaming Headset Review: All-Around-You Audio
Summary: The HyperX Cloud Orbit S makes audio sound like it’s filling the room. The headset can be advantageous for gamers, but the head tracking isn’t always noticeable.
Product_Name: HyperX Cloud Orbit S Gaming Headset
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The HyperX Cloud Orbit S makes games and music sound like they’re filling the room. The headset can be an asset in gaming, but the head tracking feature is more noticeable in some games than others.

Title: SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless Gaming Headset Review: High-Quality Hi-Res
Summary: It's a big outlay that SteelSeries is asking for with their top-of-the-range Arctis, but for the money you're showered with premium features that assuage any buyer's remorse.
Product_Name: SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless Gaming Headset
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: It's a big outlay that SteelSeries is asking for with their top-of-the-range Arctis Pro Wireless, but for the money you're showered with premium features that assuage any buyer's remorse.

Title: Gigabyte X570-I Aorus Pro Wi-Fi Review: Ryzen 3 ITX on the Cheap
Summary: With two M.2 slots, good performance, Wi-Fi and USB-C Gen2, at a price that undercuts the competition, this ITX board is easy to recommend for SFF Ryzen 3 builders.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Gigabyte X570-I Aorus Pro WiFi performed well at stock and when overclocking. The board’s claim to fame is incorporating dual M.2 slots on the ITX form factor which no other board (at least that we know of) does. It includes two USB 3.1 Gen 2 ports on the rear IO (one Type-C, the other Type-A), with six in total. Overall, for the $220 price tag, this tiny board offers users a great assortment of features and is a well-rounded solution for a small form factor board, undercutting the competition.
column14: Low price for the feature set
column15: Low price for the feature set

Title: Acer XFA240 144Hz Gaming Monitor Review: A Bargain Speed Machine
Summary: The Acer XFA240 144 Hz gaming monitor proves responsiveness doesn’t have to be expensive, with FreeSync, G-Sync Compatibility and out-of-box- color accuracy.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: At this price, there is nothing we know of that can beat the Acer XFA240 in color accuracy, gaming performance and features. Though its pixel density is lower than we’d like, that flaw’s easy to ignore when rocking our favorite first-person games at 144 fps.

Title: HP Omen X 25f 240 Hz Gaming Monitor Review: Speed and Style
Summary: HP gets into the super-fast gaming monitor market with the 240 Hz Omen X 25f with FreeSync and G-Sync Compatibility. It’s fit for gamers seeking top framerates.
Product_Name: HP Omen X 25f 240 Hz Gaming Monitor
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: Though it has a bit less contrast than rival screens, the HP Omen X 25f delivers on all the things that matter to gaming enthusiasts. It ensures an awesome experience suited to the best players and can make the casual gamer more competitive.

Title: Endgame Gear XM1 Gaming Mouse Review: High-Performance Simplicity
Summary: The Endgame Gear XM1 gaming mouse is versatile and attractively priced debut that will appeal to eSports-minded FPS gamers most.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: A versatile and attractively priced debut from Endgame Gear that will appeal to eSports-minded FPS gamers more than most, the XM1's flaws are minor and unrelated to its fundamental performance.

Title: Razer Huntsman Tournament Edition Keyboard Review: Optical Switches for Esports
Summary: Razer’s latest Huntsman is compact, and packs a new optical switch with a 1mm actuation point. Is it worth the $130 price?
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Razer’s latest keyboard features a new optical switch with fast 1mm actuation and an esports-friendly compact design. But unless you’re truly an elite gamer looking to take a $130 chance on the Huntsman Tournament Edition giving you a gaming edge, there are better, cheaper options out there.

Title: Adata XPG SX6000 Pro M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Paying More for Less
Summary: This SSD's DRAMless design is meant to cut costs, but is its performance really worth the money?
Product_Name: Adata XPG SX6000 Pro M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: The Adata XPG SX6000 Pro's DRAMless design is meant to cut costs, but it limits performance while competitors offer faster speeds for the same price or less.

Title: Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon (Gen 7, 2019) Review: Slim System, Fast Productivity
Summary: Lenovo’s 7th Gen X1 Carbon is the productivity laptop to beat, if you can afford its high price.
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: Lenovo’s 7th Gen X1 Carbon is the productivity laptop to beat, if you can afford its high price.

Title: Corsair HS35 Gaming Headset Review: Style on a Budget
Summary: Corsair's HS35 makes a lot of great calls in the design category. But unfortunately this budget gaming headset can't quite nail the fundamental audio quality.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Corsair's HS35 makes a lot of great calls in the design category. But unfortunately this budget gaming headset can't quite nail the fundamental audio quality. An extra $20-$30 buys you much more quality.

Title: Asus Zenbook Pro Duo Review: Dual-Screen Suave
Summary: Asus’ dual-screen laptop is better designed and generally more useful than the competition. But there’s still lots of room for improvement.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Asus’ dual-screen laptop is better designed and generally more useful than the competition. But there’s still lots of room for improvement.
column14: Well-implemented and eye-catching second screen above the keyboard
column15: Well-implemented and eye-catching second screen above the keyboard

Title: Corsair M55 RGB Pro Review: Speedy Budget Gaming Mouse
Summary: The Corsair M55 RGB Pro is a great budget gaming mouse for twitch shooters and games where fast response times are everything.
Author: Matthew Hanson
column13: The Corsair M55 RGB Pro is a great budget mouse for twitch shooters and games where fast response times are everything.

Title: Corsair iCUE 220T RGB Airflow Chassis Review: Compact ATX Performer
Summary: Corsair’s iCUE 220T RGB Airflow chassis, is an intriguing reimagining of what is perhaps the most empirically important piece of case design out there: good airflow.
Author: Zak Storey
column13: Corsair’s iCUE 220T RGB Airflow chassis is an interesting step into a new aesthetic style for Corsair. Despite worries over intake airflow, the case performs well. But it lacks common hardware configuration support found from its competitors at this price point.

Title: Corsair K83 Wireless Entertainment Keyboard Review: Living Room Lounger
Summary: There's a huge amount to love about the Corsair K83, but there's also a whole host of crazy features bolted on to it that don't come close to reaching their potential.
Author: Alex Cox
column13: There's a huge amount to love about the Corsair K83, but there's also a whole host of crazy features bolted onto it that don't come close to reaching their potential. Given that it's directly fighting much cheaper products, we expected the K83's gimmicks to work a little harder.

Title: Acer Predator Helios 700 Review: The Big Switcheroo
Summary: The Acer Predator Helios uses an innovative sliding keyboard to enable extra cooling, which leads to strong performance, but it sure is heavy.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Acer Predator Helios uses an innovative sliding keyboard to enable extra cooling, which leads to strong performance, but it sure is heavy.

Title: Aorus KD25F 240 Hz Gaming Monitor Review: Breaking Our Benchmark Records
Summary: For hardcore gaming, we can’t imagine a better display than he 25-inch, 240 Hz Aorus KD25F. With ESP-like response, this gaming monitor is worth the price.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: For hardcore gaming, we can’t imagine a better display. The Aorus KD25F combines a super-fast panel with accurate color and response that almost anticipates control inputs. Once you’ve played your favorite shooter on it, you won’t be able to stop.

Title: G.Skill Trident Z Neo 4x8GB Review: DDR4-3600 For AMD X570
Summary: G.Skill was first to offer a new memory series optimized for AMD’s Ryzen 3000 memory controller, but does it make X570 better?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Buyers who aren't satisfied by AMD’s ordinary DDR4-3200 recommendation should be happy with G.Skill’s Trident Z Neo DDR4-3600 C16 kit. The attractive heat spreaders will also dress up their build, along with bringing a speed increase.
column14: Low-latency CAS 16 straight timings at DDR4-3600
column15: Low-latency CAS 16 straight timings at DDR4-3600

Title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2019 Review: Lightweight, Simple, Reliable
Summary: Kaspersky is short on bonus features, but the core antivirus engine is a class leader, particularly with zero-day threats.
Author: Jonas DeMuro
column13: Kaspersky is short on bonus features, but the core antivirus engine is a class leader, particularly with zero-day threats.

Title: Lenovo Legion Y545 Laptop Review: Glam-Free Gaming
Summary: With a simple, RGB-free design, the Lenovo Legion Y545 is a good value. The laptop makes some sacrifices, but its gaming performance is still on point.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: With a simple, RGB-free design the Lenovo Legion Y545 is a good value. It makes some sacrifices to keep its price competitive, but its gaming performance is still on point.

Title: HP Omen Obelisk 2019 Review: Now With More Power
Summary: The HP Omen Obelisk is a sleek desktop with premium part options, but it’s case design makes it difficult to make significant upgrades in the future.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The HP Omen Obelisk is a sleek desktop with premium part options, but its case design makes it difficult to make significant upgrades in the future.

Title: XPG Spectrix D60G DDR4-3600 Review: Plastic Fantastic
Summary: Can an RGB memory kit with light diffusers this large still outperform competitors? We put XPGs fastest Spectrix D60G to the test!
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Users who just want the widened light diffusers can find them on cheaper models of Spectrix D60G, but those who also want top performance do well to consider the winning nature of this P/N AX4U360038G17-DT60 DDR4-3600 kit.

Title: Hack Kids Laptop Offers More Frustration than Fun
Summary: The Hack Laptop is supposed to teach kids to code, but poorly-designed lessons make it an exercise in frustration.
Product_Name: Hack Kids Laptop Offers More Frustration than Fun
Author: Sarah Lord
column13: The Hack laptop attempts to teach kids how to code through fun, interactive games. Unfortunately, the limited content is more frustrating than fun, making this an expensive and uninteresting way to learn the basics of coding.

Title: Sennheiser GSP 670 Gaming Headset Review: Wireless Luxury
Summary: The Sennheiser GSP 670 is a truly luxurious and comprehensive wireless gaming headset that really sings, whether for music, film, or gaming.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: The Sennheiser GSP 670 is a truly luxurious and comprehensive wireless gaming headset that really sings, whether for music, film, or gaming.

Title: LaCie 2big RAID 16TB Review: Big on Reliability and Capacity
Summary: With spacious capacities and a 10Gb/s USB 3.1 Type-C interface, LaCie’s got a new professional desktop RAID device that is ideal for the creative pro looking to up their storage game.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: LaCie’s 2big RAID is a high capacity workhorse of an external. Creative pros can purchase the 2big RAID in confidence knowing it features two enterprise-class HDDs and comes backed by a five-year warranty and data recovery coverage. While it is pricey for the average consumer, it is quite the bang for the buck for prosumers.

Title: Biostar Racing X570GT8 Motherboard Review: Affordable M.2 Excess
Summary: For those looking for lots of M.2 support on a budget, the Biostar X570GT8 is easy to recommend. Just note that there’s no Wi-Fi here. And our overclocking experience wasn’t the best.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: Biostar’s current sole X570 board is the least-expensive option that includes three heatsink-covered M.2 slots, while still including six SATA ports. Stock performance is on par with the competition, but overclocking was a bit of a disappointment. It’s a solid choice for builds focused on storage, but I wonder how it will handle overclocking future high-end Ryzen CPUs.

Title: Cooler Master Silencio S400 Micro ATX Case Review: Quietly Affordable
Summary: Master’s Silencio 400 focuses on quietness and a moderate price. Does it perform well-enough to become a value leader?
Product_Name: Cooler Master Silencio S400 Micro ATX Case
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: The embodiment of the term "silence is golden,” Cooler Master’s Silencio S400 comes with an external drive optical drive bay and reversible front panel, ventilated and solid top panels, an SD card reader and sound damping material on all panels. The $90 / £90 asking price is also lower than most other cases in its class, leaving room in your budget for an extra intake fan if so desired.

Title: MSI GT76 Titan Gaming Laptop Review: Big, Bright and Powerful
Summary: The MSI GT76 Titan gaming laptop has powerful performance with a desktop class processor, and a comfortable keyboard, but it’s also very expensive.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The MSI GT76 Titan gaming laptop has powerful performance with a desktop class processor, and a comfortable keyboard, but it’s also very expensive.

Title: Windscribe VPN Review: Feature-Packed and Affordable
Summary: Windscribe VPN’s free 10GB plan is more than enough for typical browsing, while customizable pricing is available for those with specific VPN needs.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: Windscribe VPN's free 10GB plan is more than enough for typical browsing, while customizable pricing is available for those with specific VPN needs. But you may want to stick to the IKEv2 protocol.

Title: TunnelBear VPN Review: Simple Yet Secure
Summary: TunnelBear is a user-friendly VPN that is somewhat limited in terms of pricing, supported devices and unblocking geo-restricted services.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: TunnelBear is a user-friendly VPN that is somewhat limited in terms of pricing, supported devices and unblocking geo-restricted services. But if your primary focus is privacy, you won’t be disappointed.

Title: FSP Hydro G PRO 850W Power Supply Review: Great Build, So-So Performance
Summary: The FSP Hydro G Pro 850 has excellent build quality, loads of connectors and compact dimensions. Is all that enough though to justify the $139 MSRP?
Product_Name: FSP Hydro G PRO 850W Power Supply
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The FSP Hydro Pro G 850W uses high-quality parts, and a hefty warranty supports it. But its performance is lags behind the competition, and it's only quiet under very light loads.

Title: Asus ROG Strix X570-E Gaming Review: More Fast USB, Lower Price
Summary: Asus undercuts MSI and Gigabyte for enthusiast-class X570 pricing, but does it still deliver the goods regarding features and overclocking?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: With only two M.2 slots but eight I/O-panel USB3 Gen2 and eight SATA ports, the Asus ROG Strix X570-E Gaming is more of a power-user board than a gamer. But compared to competing models, its lower price and robust feature set makes it easy to recommend among early X570 offerings.
column14: More USB3 Gen2 ports than competitors
column15: More USB3 Gen2 ports than competitors

Title: Gigabyte Z390 Gaming X Review: Budget Board Bliss?
Summary: Can Gigabyte deliver a good Z390 overclocking board for under $150? We find out in our review of the Gaming X.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The Z390 Gaming X is the cheapest way we know of overclock a Core i9-9900K, even if it needs extra cooling to do so. Users with lower-model processors will have even better results.

Title: AMD Ryzen 5 3600X Review: the New Mid-Range CPU Leader
Summary: Out of the box, the Ryzen 5 3600X is the best processor in its price range for gaming and productivity, marking a massive shift in the mid-range competitive landscape.
Author: Paul Alcorn
column13: Out of the box, the Ryzen 5 3600X is the best processor in its price range for gaming and productivity. AMD throws in support for PCIe 4.0, superior power efficiency, an auto-overclocking tool, and capable bundled cooler, making the Ryzen 5 3600X the best mid-range processor on the market.

Title: VyprVPN Review: Top-Tier VPN Service
Summary: With a strong privacy platform with solid performance and all the features typically expected of a good VPN service, like fast speeds, VyprVPN will satisfy most.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: VyprVPN will satisfy most users with its strong privacy platform with solid performance and all the features typically expected of a good VPN service, like fast speeds.

Title: LaCie Mobile Drive Portable HDD Review: Pretty Portable
Summary: LaCie's Mobile Drive is the nicest-looking portable drive available. But unless you want to test drive the included free month of Adobe CC, there are better options.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: LaCie’s Mobile Drive features a sleek design and an Apple-like finish. It's priced at a premium over alternatives in the market, but outside of aesthetics, it's similar in performance and capacity to drives that cost less. So unless you're primarily interested in looks or in trying out the free month of Adobes Creative Cloud, there are better options available for less.

Title: Norton AntiVirus Software Review: Easy on the PC
Summary: Norton AntiVirus is precise and easy to use but disappoints when it comes to ransomware protection.
Author: Jonas DeMuro
column13: Norton’s antivirus solution is precise and easy to use but disappoints when it comes to ransomware protection.

Title: T-Force Vulcan Z 2x 8GB DDR4-3200 C16 Kit Review: More Value For Asus Motherboards
Summary: Team Group charges hard into the value segment of the enthusiast market with an unlit DDR4-3200 C16 kit. Is it the right value for your build?
Product_Name: T-Force Vulcan Z 2x 8GB DDR4-3200 C16 Kit
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Team Group’s RGB-free Vulcan Z DDR4-3200 C16 gets the performance-to-price ratio needed to win us over for value, but its full performance is only available when installed on an Asus motherboard.

Title: CyberGhost VPN Review: Good for the Money
Summary: CyberGhost offers strong security, supports torrenting and gives access to Netflix on as many as 7 devices at the same time.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: CyberGhost offers strong security, supports torrenting and gives access to Netflix on as many as 7 devices at the same time. However its performance is sometimes hurt by minor connectivity lag.

Title: NZXT H510 Elite Review: A Performance Show Case
Summary: Tempered glass panels and RGB lighting make NZXT’s H510 Elite a showcase your components. But can this showy case outclass its own H510 and H510i?
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: The NZXT H510 Elite really does have it all, including a $170 price that, given its good thermal performance, quiet operation, tempered glass, RGB lighting, USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C and a sleek and stylish design, seems reasonable. But if you have fans you can carry over, older 500-series chassis are a better buy.

Title: Fractal Design ION+ 860P Power Supply Review: Whisper Quiet
Summary: The ION+ 860P is Fractal Design's flagship power supply, offering good performance and ultra-quiet operation, even under harsh conditions.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Fractal Design ION+ 860P has good performance and dead silent operation, along with highly flexible modular cables.

Title: HP Omen X 2S Gaming Laptop Review: Mo Screens, Mo Problems
Summary: The HP Omen X 2S has a second, 6-inch display if you really hate the idea of using your phone or a second monitor for chats and other tasks while gaming.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Some gamers may find this Omen’s secondary six-inch screen worth the sacrifices in terms of peripherals and battery life. But unless you really hate the idea of using your phone or a second monitor for chats and other tasks while gaming, there are better options out there.
column14: Second 6-inch screen for game chats, tutorials or minimaps
column15: Second 6-inch screen for game chats, tutorials or minimaps

Title: Corsair Vengeance LPX DDR4-3000 Review: 2x32GB Arrives
Summary: The only option for some buyers who need 64GB on their two-slot boards, does Corsair’s Vengeance LPX have enough performance to make them feel good about that option?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: It won't win any accolades for speed or latency, but buyers who need 64GB in a dual-stick configuration who can’t wait for anything faster to show up will find Corsair’s Vengeance LPX an adequate -- and available -- option.
column14: General availability in a market where few 32GB consumer DIMMs exist
column15: General availability in a market where few 32GB consumer DIMMs exist

Title: Corsair RM750 Power Supply Review: Affordable Yet Powerful
Summary: The Corsair RM750 offers excellent performance for the price, but is only a little cheaper than the company's superior RM750x.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The RM750 is a good choice for anyone wanting a reliable and silent power supply at a decent price.

Title: Gamdias Talos P1A Review: Trendy Case With Good Performance
Summary: The Gamdias Talos P1A is a fancy case with the latest trends, like RGB and hinged tempered glass. But it lacks an intake fan filter and Type-C port.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: Offering great thermal performance, relatively quiet operation, four tempered glass panels and built in RGB lighting options, the Gamdias Talos P1A is a very nice chassis. However, similar but cheaper cases make it hard to justify the asking price.

Title: Lenovo ThinkPad T490s Laptop Review: A Good Office Worker
Summary: Looking for help in the office? The Lenovo ThinkPad T490s is a steady and reliable workhorse.
Author: Sarah Lord
column13: The ThinkPad T490s is a perfect laptop for businesses or anyone who wants a bright screen while working exclusively on spreadsheets or other office software. It ultimately lacks the power, performance or audio for much else.

Title: SteelSeries Apex Pro Mechanical Gaming Keyboard Review: Truly Personal
Summary: The SteelSeries Apex Pro RGB mechanical gaming keyboard may change the way you game. But fans of tactile typing will want more from the linear switches.
Product_Name: SteelSeries Apex Pro Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The SteelSeries Apex Pro is a beautifully RGBed keyboard with an amazing level of customization, including per-key actuation that will change how you game. But tactile typing fans will want more from the linear switches.
column14: Adjustable per-key actuation points for most keys
column15: Adjustable per-key actuation points for most keys

Title: Asus ROG Zenith Extreme Alpha Review: an X399 Thoroughbred
Summary: Now that Zen 2 is here, many are wondering if X399 is still worth their time. This reviewer says yes, and the Asus X399 Zenith Extreme Alpha is a prime example of why the AMD HEDT is here to stay.
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: Being at the top of the X399 price stack, Asus has to deliver on all fronts with its Extreme Alpha, and the company succeeds. Serious overclockers and builders with deep pockets can find value in this board compared to other current-generation product offerings. The rest of us should stick look for something (much) more affordable.

Title: ExpressVPN Review: Most Comprehensive VPN Service
Summary: Although pricier than alternatives, it’s safe for torrenting, gaming and streaming (Netflix included).
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: ExpressVPN is a very versatile VPN service, with a large number of servers spanning the globe, a strict no-logs policy and support for almost all platforms. Although pricier than alternatives, it’s safe for torrenting, gaming and streaming (Netflix included).

Title: Dell XPS 15 2019 Laptop Review: Near-Borderless OLED
Summary: The Dell XPS 15 offers an amazing display and strong performance, but OLED is only on some top models and gaming performance, if you want it, is mixed.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Dell XPS 15 offers a gorgeous display and strong performance, but OLED is only on some top models and gaming performance, if you want it, is mixed.

Title: Cooler Master V850 Platinum Power Supply Review
Summary: The Cooler Master V850 Platinum has high build quality and quiet operation. Are there better options though, with the same amount?
Product_Name: Cooler Master V850 Platinum Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Cooler Master V850 Platinum power supply is too expensive for what it has to offer. It might have top build quality but with less money you can find better performing units.

Title: Crucial P1 NVMe SSD Review: QLC Flash Gone Mild (Updated)
Summary: The Crucial P1 breaks the SATA 6Gb/s barrier with its NVMe interface and delivers up to 2/1.7 GB/s of sequential read/write throughput.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Crucial’s 500GB P1 packs three times the sequential performance of your average SATA based SSD, and brings decent 4K random performance, but is still a bit slower than competitors in application tests, even with its large SLC write cache. Even after steep price cuts, we recommend looking into other options unless the price drops even more

Title: Cooler Master GS750 RGB Headset Stand Review: Add Color, Surround Sound
Summary: The Cooler Master GS750 headset stand brings RGB and USB ports to your gaming setup, 7.1 surround sound to your cans and wireless charging to your smartphone.
Product_Name: Cooler Master GS750 RGB Headset Stand
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The Cooler Master GS750 is more than just an RGB headset stand, with its USB ports and virtual 7.1 surround sound. But we’ve seen more impressive light shows, and the wireless charging demands perfect phone placement.

Title: AMD Ryzen 7 3800X Review: Core i7 Has a New Challenger
Summary: We grabbed a Ryzen 7 3800X off a retail shelf to give it a spin in our test lab.
Author: Paul Alcorn
column13: Out of the box, the Ryzen 7 3800X offers a better mixture of single- and multi-threaded performance than Intel's competing chips, and support for the PCIe 4.0 interface unlocks the potential of ultimate storage throughput. The impressive power efficiency and performance make for a compelling upgrade, but value-seekers who aren't afraid of minimal tuning should look to the less-expensive Ryzen 7 3700X for similar performance.
column14: Solid blend of single- and multi-threaded performance
column15: Solid blend of single- and multi-threaded performance

Title: Surfshark VPN Review: Unlimited Simultaneous Connections
Summary: Surfshark has unique privacy features and is great for homes or businesses with multiple connections.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: Surfshark is an excellent VPN with some unique features providing additional security and privacy. The icing on the cake is support for unlimited simultaneous connections. But if you’re looking for a VPN to use on a monthly basis, competitors offer more flexible subscription plans.

Title: MSI MEG X570 Ace Review: Memory Speed Master?
Summary: The MEG X570 Ace reached the highest data rate our DRAM has ever seen, but what else can it offer to beat its closest rival?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Moving a few features around gives MSI a distinctive design compared to its most closely-priced rival, but both boards perform splendidly. Buyers in this price class should choose theirs based on other criteria like connector placement, aesthetics, and brand preference.

Title: Cooler Master MasterLiquid ML240P Mirage Review: See-Through CPU Cooling
Summary: Cooler Master’s new MasterLiquid ML240P Mirage provides a fresh, new view on your liquid cooler
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: While its lighting options abound and aesthetics are unique, a high $159.99 (MSRP) makes the ML240P Mirage a tough sell compared to the better-cooling, budget-friendly MasterLiquid ML240R RGB.
column14: Elegant lighting effects using a clear pump top
column15: Elegant lighting effects using a clear pump top

Title: Cooler Master V1300 Platinum Power Supply Review: Plenty of Juice
Summary: Cooler Master's top of the line V series unit is the V1300 Platinum, which has enough power to support a top-of-the-line gaming system.
Product_Name: Cooler Master V1300 Platinum Power Supply
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The V1300 has great build quality and a long warranty, but competitors with slightly-less power are more efficient and cheaper.

Title: FSP Dagger Pro 650W Power Supply Review: Compact and Strong
Summary: The FSP Dagger Pro with 650W capacity is among the strongest SFX units available on the market today. But is this enough to help it beat the competition?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: If you don't require a pair of EPS connectors, there are better options in the market for the same price, or even less.

Title: Gigabyte X570 Aorus Master Review: Expansion and M.2 Aplenty
Summary: A slight bump in features adds 20% to this X570 board over competing models. Is product design the X570 Aorus Master’s greatest advancement?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Ryzen 3000 Builders who want more slot and onboard storage availability will find it aplenty in the X570 Aorus Master. And the extra 2.5Gbps Ethernet controller is a nice extra, provided you can make use of it.

Title: Hexgears Venture Ultra-Thin Bluetooth Mechanical Keyboard Review: Slim Comfort
Summary: Choc white switches and a comfy layout make Hexgears’ low-profile keyboard a pleasing experience whether tethered or via Bluetooth.
Product_Name: Hexgears Venture Ultra-Thin Bluetooth Mechanical Keyboard
Author: Matt Safford
column13: With clicky Kailh Choc white keys and a familiar layout, Hexgears’ low-profile Venture keyboard delivers a pleasing experience whether tethered or over Bluetooth. But media keys and RGB software are frustratingly absent.

Title: HP Spectre x360 15-inch (OLED) Review: Bright Like a Diamond
Summary: The OLED version of the HP Spectre x360 (15-inch) offers a great screen and excellent speakers, but there are ugly bezels and the battery life is below average.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The OLED version of the HP Spectre x360 (15-inch) offers a great screen and excellent speakers, but you’ll have to live with ugly bezels and below-average battery life.

Title: DJI RoboMaster S1 Review: The High-End STEM Robot
Summary: DJI RoboMaster S1 is one of the most premium, high-end STEM robots we’ve seen. But younger kids will need adult assistance.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: DJI RoboMaster S1 is one of the most premium, high-end STEM robots we’ve seen. But to max its potential and make it worth the price, younger kids will need adult assistance.

Title: Mushkin Pilot M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Speed on a Budget
Summary: Mushkin has an SSD at the speed and capacity to fit almost anyone’s storage needs. And if speed is your need, the NVMe Mushkin Pilot is the drive to choose.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: While it doesn't have the newest components or the fastest performance, Mushkin's Pilot NVMe M.2 drive will get you where you're going with reasonable speed at a nice price.

Title: Adata XPG Spectrix D60G 2x 8GB DDR4-3000 Review: Upping the RGB Ante
Summary: Adata attempts to maximize lighted surface area on its D60G, but does the DRAM underneath the lights perform well?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Despite lots of RGB at a decent price, mediocre performance and lower-priced competitors prevents us from recommending Adata’s D60G DDR4-3000 to users who aren't primarily interested in this kit's aesthetics.
column14: More lighted surface area to match showy RGB builds
column15: More lighted surface area to match showy RGB builds

Title: ASRock H310M-G/M.2 Motherboard Review: Solid, but a Little Expensive
Summary: This Micro-ATX H310 motherboard from ASRock delivers the basics and well-rounded design, but it’s a little expensive for what you get.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: This basic Micro-ATX H310 based motherboard is solid, but priced too high compared to other boards with similar features.

Title: Acer Predator Triton 900 Gaming Laptop Review: Flipping Out
Summary: The Acer Predator Triton 900 is a big laptop with a unique hinge, but has an awkward keyboard and isn’t as easy to upgrade as other laptops.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Acer Predator Triton 900 is a big laptop with a unique hinge, but has an awkward keyboard and isn’t as easy to upgrade as other laptops.

Title: Oculus Rift S Review: First-Gen VR Gets a Reboot
Summary: The Rift S isn’t a second-gen headset, but more like a do-over of the original, with improvements and compromises. If you have a headset, you can skip this one.
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: There's a fair bit to like about the Rift S. But the original set a high bar that this model doesn’t really move higher. If you're shopping for your first VR setup, it's worth considering. But no one should upgrade to the Rift S.

Title: Patriot Viper Elite 2x 16GB DDR4-2400 Review: Covering The Basics
Summary: Some systems can’t configure high-data-rate memory: Is Patriot's Viper Elite the ultimate solution?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Competing against dozens of similarly-rated kits for a similar price, the aesthetics of Patriot’s Viper Elite DDR4-2400 CAS 15 becomes the primary reason for buyers to chose it. Anyone who can use a higher-speed kit should probably spend a few dollars more for one of those options instead.

Title: Team Group MP34 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: A Killer Value
Summary: With very good performance at surprisingly reasonable pricing, plus high endurance, Team Group's MP34 is a very good value-focused NVMe M.2 SSD.
Product_Name: Team Group MP34 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Team Group’s MP34 is a fairly ordinary Phison E12 based SSD, but it comes into the market at impressive prices while offering high-end performance and robust endurance. If you're in the market for a budget NVMe SSD, this is one that deserves to be on your short list.

Title: Dell G7 15 2019 Gaming Laptop Review: Understated Performer
Summary: The Dell G7 15 (2019) has a subtle design that’s upgrade-friendly with decent all-around performance.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The Dell G7 15 has a subtle design that’s upgrade-friendly with decent all-around performance. But competitors offer more-colorful screens, and sound quality could use a boost.

Title: GeForce RTX 2060 and 2070 Super Review: Nvidia Preemptively Strikes Navi
Summary: Nvidia just rained on AMD's parade. The new GeForce RTX 2070 Super and GeForce RTX 2060 Super are a preemptive strike against Radeon RX 5700 XT and RX 5700.
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: Although we aren’t sure who asked for something in between the GeForce RTX 2060 and GeForce RTX 2070 Super, Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 2060 Super does deliver smooth frame rates across our benchmark suite at 2560 x 1440 at maxed-out detail settings. Support for real-time ray hybrid ray tracing technologies should become even more of a differentiator as time passes.
column14: Strong performance at 2560 x 1440 for less money than the GeForce RTX 2070
column15: Strong performance at 2560 x 1440 for less money than the GeForce RTX 2070

Title: Cougar Gemini ATX Case Review: Stylish, but Not Cool Enough
Summary: Cougar wants its Gemini T to be the best in its class, but can it offer enough features, quality and performance to justify its price class?
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: The Cougar Gemini T is a very nice case that comes packed with features. Unfortunately there are a few minor problems that keep this chassis from achieving greatness, especially at $189.99 (£ 149.43). That said, a price drop or the addition of a few more cooling fans would make this chassis a real contender.

Title: ID Cooling Auraflow X 240 Cooler Review: Nicely Priced
Summary: ID Cooling's Auraflow X 240 offers budget-friendly liquid cooling, mid-range performance, and lackluster RGB illumination.
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: The ID Cooling Auraflow X 240 sits at a unique place in the market as it appeals to the system builder looking for a 240mm AIO, but might not have the cooling budget to go for a top-performing cooler with a dedicated software control suite.

Title: Razer Blade 15 Advanced Model Review: 240Hz, Esports Ready Display
Summary: In esports, every frame counts. The 240Hz display on the Razer Blade 15 Advanced Model is one of the speediest displays I’ve seen.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Razer Blade 15 Advanced Model offers a blazing 240Hz display and good looks, but it’s dim, and the awkward keyboard might put off some gamers.

Title: Seasonic Focus SGX 500W SFX-L Power Supply Review: Top Performance In A Small Package
Summary: The Seasonic Focus SGX units bring a fresh air in the SFX-L market thanks to their high performance per buck ratios.
Product_Name: Seasonic Focus SGX 500W SFX-L Power Supply
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Seasonic SSR-500SGX has a fair price and offers good performance, but we wish it came with an additional SATA cable.

Title: G.Skill Trident Z RGB AMD DDR4-3466 4x 8GB CL18 Kit Review: Beautiful, but Average
Summary: G.Skill has had success making competitively priced kits for mainstream platforms. But how does its latest Threadripper kit fare against the competition?
Product_Name: G.Skill Trident Z RGB AMD DDR4-3466 4x 8GB CL18 Kit
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: If you're after an RGB kit for a Threadripper build, this X399-focused G.Skill Trident-Z model is a solid performer. Although you may want to keep an eye out for a sale price.
column14: Average XMP performance across data rates
column15: Average XMP performance across data rates

Title: Cooler Master MasterKeys MK850 Gaming Keyboard Review: Analog Excellence
Summary: While the price is high and there's room for improvement--or just other switch options--the MK850 is the current pinnacle of analog keyboard excellence.
Product_Name: Cooler Master MasterKeys MK850 Gaming Keyboard
Author: Alex Cox
column13: Cooler Master has produced the current pinnacle of what an analog keyboard should be. Although the price may be extreme, the complement of features is spectacular.

Title: Silicon Power XPower Turbine DDR4-3200 Kit Review: Inexpensive RGB
Summary: Silicon Power joins the most price-competitive segment of the high-end DDR4 market: Can it beat established players?
Product_Name: Silicon Power XPower Turbine DDR4-3200 Kit
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: For about the same price as competing solutions, Silicon Power’s XPower Turbine RGB offers a miniscule performance edge and cutting-edge aesthetics.

Title: Creative SXFI Air Headset Review: Versatile but Bulky
Summary: The Creative SXFI Air excels against similarly priced rivals in audio and gaming, but it's best suited to those who are gamers first, but want their media to sound good, too.
Author: Andy Hartup
column13: A versatile and accomplished headset, the SXFI Air is a great buy for anyone looking to play games, watch movies, and binge TV with great, affordable, but not-quite-top-end audio.

Title: ViewSonic Elite XG350R-C 35-inch Curved QHD Gaming Monitor Review: Mid-Priced Excellence
Summary: The ViewSonic XG350R-C Elite is a 35-inch curved VA screen with AMD FreeSync and non-official Nvidia G-Sync compatibility.
Product_Name: ViewSonic Elite XG350R-C 35-inch Curved QHD Gaming Monitor
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: While the ViewSonic XG350R-C doesn’t offer any improvement with HDR material, it delivers a superb gameplay experience, thanks to running both flavors of adaptive sync, as well as bringing excellent contrast and accurate color.

Title: Insta360 Evo VR Camera Review: Good Camera, Bad Stitching
Summary: The Insta360 Evo 5.7K VR camera with 360-degree mono and 180-degree stereo captures clear images and video, but could use an improved stitching algorithm.
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: The Insta360 Evo is a versatile little camera that offers crisp capture quality in both 360-degree and 180-degree configurations, but it suffers from short battery life and unfortunately poor stitching quality. It’s a good device for the casual user, but professional and hobbyist photographers would do well to look elsewhere.

Title: MSI H310M Gaming Plus Motherboard Review: Affordable Basics
Summary: MSI’s $75 / £68 Micro-ATX H310M Gaming Plus offers users a mostly well-equipped solution for those on a tight build budget who don’t not plan on overclocking.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: If you don’t plan to overclock and want to save some cash, MSI’s 310M Gaming Plus is a solid foundation for an Intel-based build on a budget.

Title: Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 Low Profile Gaming Keyboard Review: Slim Complications
Summary: Corsair’s K70 RGB MK.2 swaps out the full-sized switches for low profile ones. The results are mixed, and we'd like to see a price drop.
Product_Name: Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 Low Profile Gaming Keyboard
Author: Alex Cox
column13: Unless you were absolutely tied to the idea of low-profile keys, we'd probably opt for the big boy K70 over this. It's a fine keyboard with some smart features, but there's a lot not to like – and much of that is the fault of its switches.

Title: Razer Huntsman Optical Keyboard Review: Superb Purple Switches
Summary: Packed with excellent purple opto-mechanical switches and wrapped in a classy subdued shell, Razer's lesser huntsman impresses, despite its fairly high price.
Author: Alex Cox
column13: The Huntsman packs possibly the finest mass-market key switch available today, in a package which oozes class. Rarely has a keyboard this basic, at this price, earned its asking price so handily.

Title: ASRock Z390 Phantom Gaming 7 Motherboard Review: Fast Ethernet Slips Under $200
Summary: ASRock’s manages to deliver integrated 2.5GbE at under $200, but mediocre overclocking and high temps with the stock i9-9900K hold this board back.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Builders prioritizing 2.5GbE and installing a Core i9-9900K should skip the Z390 Phantom Gaming 7 and step up to the Z390 Phantom Gaming 9. Those who don’t truly need 2.5GbE will find better in competing models.

Title: ViewSonic Elite XG240R 144 Hz Gaming Monitor Review: Speed and Versatility
Summary: The ViewSonic Elite XG240R gaming monitor features a 24-inch TN screen with FHD resolution, FreeSync, 144 Hz and seriously-quick response; all wrapped in a solid chassis at a great price.
Product_Name: ViewSonic Elite XG240R 144 Hz Gaming Monitor
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: For the price, the ViewSonic Elite XG240R is hard to beat. It offers enough performance for the most competitive gamers and delivers a premium-quality image no matter the content.

Title: Logitech G502 Lightspeed Review: Expensive Mousing Excellence
Summary: The Logitech G502 Lightspeed takes a classic gaming mouse and gives it long battery life and lighter weight, but it’s on the pricey side.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Logitech G502 Lightspeed updates a classic gaming mouse, giving it long battery life and lighter weight, but it’s on the pricey side.

Title: zSpace Review: This Is What an AR Laptop Can Do
Summary: The zSpace has 3D and AR capabilities unlike any laptop. It’s an innovative new approach to education but a bit laggy when it comes to typical productivity.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The zSpace has 3D and AR capabilities unlike any laptop. It’s an innovative new approach to education but a bit laggy when it comes to typical productivity.

Title: Kingston KC2000 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Top Notch Components and Security
Summary: Kingston designed its new KC2000 SSD for gamers, prosumers, and corporate users alike with top-notch security and solid performance that spans up to 3.2/2.2 GB/s.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Kingston’s KC2000 keeps up with the most intensive consumer workloads, but also boasts respectable endurance figures, a five-year warranty, software package, and a full security suite, making it a safe choice if you're looking for security and reliability, too.

Title: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1660 Gaming OC 6G Review: A Mainstream Turing Hotrod
Summary: Gigabyte's GeForce GTX 1660 Gaming OC 6G combines premium cooling with a mainstream GPU, resulting in slow-spinning fans, low temperatures, and high clock rates. A modest mark-up keeps us interested long enough to recognize this card's value.
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: Gigabyte’s Windforce 3X delivers practical benefits in the GeForce GTX 1660 Gaming OC 6G, facilitating lower operating temperatures, slower-spinning fans, and more aggressive clock rates than competing cards. While we’re typically not proponents of spending more money than necessary on mainstream GPUs, this is one model worth its modest premium.
column14: Windforce 3X cooler is great for low temps without much noise
column15: Windforce 3X cooler is great for low temps without much noise

Title: Roccat Kova Aimo Gaming Mouse Review: Subtle, Yet Powerful
Summary: A good gaming mouse for the price, the Roccat Kova Aimo is a no-nonsense pointer with an attractive but understated aesthetic.
Author: Matthew Hanson
column13: A good gaming mouse for the price, the Roccat Kova Aimo is a no-nonsense pointer with an attractive but understated aesthetic.

Title: Beyerdynamic Fox USB Studio Microphone Review: Pop-Shielded Excellence
Summary: Beyerdynamic wedges its way into the game streaming market with its impressive Fox standalone mic.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Finally, the line between good-quality USB streamer mics and studio equipment with pro-audio specs has started to blur. This Fox offers the best of both worlds for an amazing price, all things considered.

Title: Asus ROG Zephyrus G GA502 Gaming Laptop Review: AMD and Nvidia in One Machine
Summary: The Asus ROG Zephyrus G GA502 is a sleek flagship AMD Ryzen gaming laptop with Nvidia’s GTX 1660 Ti.
Product_Name: Asus ROG Zephyrus G GA502 Gaming Laptop
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Asus ROG Zephyrus G GA502 is a good value, with solid performance and better battery life than some Intel-based counterparts. But it has a dim display and no webcam.

Title: Hexgears Impulse Keyboard Review: Best for Typing
Summary: The ultimate typing keyboard, the Hexgears Impulse and its Box White Switches will make you faster and more comfortable for both work and play.
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: The ultimate typing keyboard, the Hexgears Impulse will make you faster and more comfortable, but it lacks dedicated software and its RGB lights are dull and bland.

Title: Asus ROG Strix B450-F Gaming Motherboard Review: Premium Looks, Budget Price
Summary: The Strix B450-F Gaming is a middle of the road gaming motherboard from its ROG lineup. With a price of $120 and support for both AMD- and Nvidia-based multi-GPU builds, it’s a solid mid-range board, with some premium aesthetics.
Product_Name: Asus ROG Strix B450-F Gaming Motherboard
Author: Joe Shields
column13: A gaming centric motherboard with a $120 price tag that looks good and includes a well rounded feature set assuming Wi-Fi isn’t tops on your list of needs.

Title: Kingston HyperX QuadCast Gaming Microphone Review
Summary: Kingston's unusual three-diaphragm design produces great sound at a low price. The Quadcast's controls are also intuitive for any gamer or game streamer.
Product_Name: Kingston HyperX QuadCast Gaming Microphone Review
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Kingston's unusual design incorporating three diaphragms produces great sound at a low price. The Quadcast's controls are also intuitive for any gamer or game streamer.

Title: HyperX Predator 2x16GB DDR4-3600 C17 Review: RGB-Free, for a Price
Summary: HyperX Predator's 2x16GB 3600 kit offers a performance bump with good DDR4-3600 timings, but at what cost?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The HyperX DDR4-3600 C17 2x 16GB kit sports good timings and an XMP backup for boards that can't handle its high advertised speed. But it's a little expensive considering its lack of a built-in light show.

Title: Alienware m15 (OLED) Gaming Laptop Review: Most Vibrant Screen We've Seen
Summary: The Alienware m15's optional OLED panel literally changes the game with its eye-popping colors.
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: The Alienware m15's optional OLED panel literally changes the game with its eye-popping colors.

Title: Corsair RM850 Power Supply Review: A Solid Value
Summary: The Corsair RM850 power supply is a more affordable version of the highly successful RM850x, featuring good performance and silent operation.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The RM850 offers solid performance at a reasonable price, but only consider it if the street price is significantly lower than the RM850x.

Title: Patriot Viper Steel 2x 16GB DDR4-3200 C16 Kit: Disruptive Value
Summary: Just when we thought we’d found the ultimate value in a 32GB dual-channel performance kit, Patriot stepped in to deliver low-priced RAM excellence.
Product_Name: Patriot Viper Steel 2x 16GB DDR4-3200 C16 Kit: Disruptive Value
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Patriot’s entry to our recent 2x 16GB DDR4 comparisons makes a strong value statement, with superb pricing and good DDR4-3200-class performance.

Title: Patriot Viper VPN100 NVMe SSD Review: A Tactical Upgrade
Summary: Patriot's latest SSD comes with a powerful and proven design from Phison, an impressive heatsink, and write endurance to handle any task.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Looking for a fancy new M.2 SSD to throw into your build and don’t want that extra RGB bling, but want a heatsink to keep your drive cool? Though it isn’t a chart-topper, the Patriot Viper VPN100 has what it takes to compete with the best, and the write endurance to power through almost anything you can throw at it.

Title: SilverStone ST1000-PTS Power Supply Review: Downsizing To The Extreme
Summary: The SilverStone ST1000-PTS has 554W per liter power density, thanks to its 1kW capacity and the compact dimensions. Is it a good option for $254 (£195)?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The ST1000-PTS has compact dimensions and achieves high efficiency but there are better options in the same price range.

Title: Razer Seiren X Microphone Review: Compact Streamer Upgrade
Summary: For streamers who need a portable or space-saving setup, the Seiren X is a good fit, offering crystal-clear vocals. But it picks up keyboard and mouse clicks.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: For streamers who need a portable and / or space-saving setup, the Seiren X is a good fit, offering crystal-clear vocals. But despite its "supercardioid" polar pattern, it does pick up keyboard and mouse clicks.

Title: Fractal Design Define S2 Vision Case Review: Excellence at a Cost
Summary: It’s expensive, but Fractal Design's Define S2 Vision has everything an enthusiast could want, including stellar performance and ARGB options aplenty.
Product_Name: Fractal Design Define S2 Vision Case
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: With great thermal performance, sleek styling, tempered glass panels all the way around, and ARGB lighting options galore, Fractal Design's Define S2 Vision delivers everything an enthusiast could want and more.

Title: Corsair Glaive RGB Pro Gaming Mouse Review: Get a Grip (or Three)
Summary: The Corsair Glaive RGB Pro doesn’t come cheap and lacks the ability to adjust its weight, but it offers an overall great user experience and swappable side grips.
Product_Name: Corsair Glaive RGB Pro Gaming Mouse
Author: Zak Storey
column13: Corsair’s Glaive RGB Pro is a strong addition to any gaming setup, as long as you’re big into your palm grips, and don’t mind forking out the cash.

Title: G.Skill Trident Z RGB 2x 16GB DDR4-3600 C17 Kit Review: Elusive Value
Summary: Can an RGB memory kit offer better value at DDR4-3600 CAS 17? Perhaps not in the US. But it may be tough to find this G.Skill kit in stock when you’re ready to buy.
Product_Name: G.Skill Trident Z RGB 2x 16GB DDR4-3600 C17 Kit
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: We could easily recommend the 2x16GB version of G.Skill’s Trident Z RGB DDR4-3600 C17, if only we could find it consistently in stock. If you’re interested and find it in stock at a reasonable price, snatch it up. But we don’t recommend waiting for availability when the market offers so many other compelling options.
column14: Good timings for the data rate
column15: Good timings for the data rate

Title: Oculus Quest Review: VR Just Ditched the PC
Summary: The Oculus Quest could be the device that turns the VR market around and attracts the masses. It’s basically a game console built into a headset, done right.
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: The Oculus Quest is everything most people need in a VR system. It’s easy to configure and convenient to set up and tote around. The experiences it offers are every bit as immersive as a PC-connected room-scale VR system.

Title: Apexgaming X-Mars Junior Case Review
Summary: Apexgaming assures us that the X-Mars Junior has all the features a modern high-end PC requires. Sporting a premium price tag of $190 (£146.20), can this chassis check all the right boxes to earn our approval?
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: A solid chassis with admirable features the X-Mars Junior is a bit overpriced compared to the competition. Thermal performance could be drastically improved with the addition of a few intake fans, but that in turn adds to the overall cost of the case. If you like the look, styling and features, a price drop of at least $20 (£15.39) could justify spending extra cash to spend on two additional intake fans.

Title: Cooler Master MasterBox Q500L ATX Mini-Tower Review
Summary: Can Cooler Master’s compact, budget-priced Q500L deliver full-ATX excellence in a case that’s just 15 inches square?
Product_Name: Cooler Master MasterBox Q500L ATX Mini-Tower Review
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: A great chassis for the money, the Cooler Master MasterBox Q500L has everything a gaming enthusiast on a budget needs, at a great price. Shortcomings such as the lack of an intake fan can easily be remedied by installing one yourself. Given the case’s low price, that shouldn’t be a problem.

Title: Lenovo ThinkPad L390 Yoga Review: Business Basics
Summary: Lenovo’s ThinkPad L390 Yoga is a capable, but not powerful, 2-in-1 aimed at businesses.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: Lenovo’s ThinkPad L390 Yoga is a capable, but not powerful, 2-in-1 aimed at businesses. If you’re just filling out some spreadsheets, using chat apps or word processing, it will get the job done.

Title: ASRock X399 Phantom Gaming 6 Review: A Low(er)-Priced Gateway to X399
Summary: If you're thinking about joining the high-core-count club, but $300-plus board prices have scared you off, ASRock’s $240 Phantom Gaming 6 may lure you back.
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: ASRock does an excellent job of tweaking its design to shave money off its budget-priced X399 board, delivering an adequately equipped and modestly performing motherboard. Though not quite on-par with typical X399 offerings, this interpretation of the chipset may force others to lower the cost of entry into AMD's HEDT space.

Title: HyperX Predator RGB 2x16GB DDR4-3200 Review: A 32GB Dual-Stick Value
Summary: 32GB helps maintain program performance when multitasking, but some boards don’t have enough slots for a 4x 8GB kit. Kingston shows us a two-DIMM solution.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The HyperX Predator RGB DDR4-3200 provides good value for a 32GB kit, and its 2 x 16GB configuration is required to get two-slot boards up to that capacity.

Title: Intel Cascade Lake Xeon Platinum 8280, 8268, and Gold 6230 Review: Taking The Fight to EPYC
Summary: Intel's Cascade Lake wades into market against AMD's EPYC lineup.
Product_Name: Intel Cascade Lake Xeon Platinum 8280, 8268, and Gold 6230
Author: Paul Alcorn
column13: Intel's Second Generation Xeon Scalable processors build on the success of its first-gen models and add support for the innovative Optane DC Persistent Memory DIMMs. The line-up does offer significant price-to-performance improvements, though less expensive processors from AMD are worth considering for some applications.
column14: Strong performance in a broad range of workloads
column15: Strong performance in a broad range of workloads

Title: Z390 on the Cheap: Overclocking a Core i5 With Three Budget Boards
Summary: As cheap boards struggled to support Intel’s power-hungry ~$500 Core i9-9900K, budget builders and product designers wanted to know what would happen if a reasonably-priced CPU was used instead. We found out!
Product_Name: Z390 on the Cheap: Overclocking a Core i5 With Three Budget Boards
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The sparsely-featured Z390 Gaming SLI’s better power regulator makes our CPUs perform better and operate more efficiently.
column14: Better support for Core i9-9900K upgrades
column15: Better support for Core i9-9900K upgrades

Title: Sphero Bolt Review: Can This Robot Ball Teach Code?
Summary: Sphero Bolt is a STEM toy robot that teaches programming by block-based coding or JavaScript. Its Sphero Edu app is helpful but works better in the classroom.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: Sphero Bolt is a simple, fun toy that can teach children block coding with ample tutorials and videos, but its lessons are geared toward classrooms and lack incentives for children playing on their own at home.

Title: Antec P101 Silent Case Review: Old-School Cool (and Quiet)
Summary: If you are in the market for a chassis with a minimalistic yet elegant design with a concealed external bay for an optical drive (or front-panel devices ), Antec says the P101 Silent is the case for you.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: If silence is high on your priority list, without having to sacrifice cooling performance, Antec's P101 Silent should definitely be at the top of your case consideration list. The lack of USB 3.1 Type-C port, though disappointing, is softened by this chassis' budget friendly $110 (£84.64) price.

Title: Enermax MaxRevo 1800W Power Supply Review: Big Wattage and Noise to Match
Summary: This PSU behemoth delivers up to 1800W of power with 230V input, but is it worth the hefty price tag?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Enermax EMR1800EXT is only suitable for users that need a super strong PSU and don't care at all about the output noise.

Title: Cooler Master SK621 Mechanical Keyboard Review: Travel-Friendly Typer
Summary: Cooler Master’s tiny (60%) is as travel-friendly as mechanicals get. But its layout will take some getting used to.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Cooler Master’s smallest (60%) wireless/wired mechanical keyboard strikes a contentious balance between form and function. But if you like flat caps and are willing to live with a few oddly placed keys for the benefit of extreme portability, it should serve you well.

Title: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1660 Ti Gaming OC 6G Review: Mid-Range Turing Goes Premium
Summary: Gigabyte's GeForce GTX 1660 Ti Gaming OC 6G takes an Nvidia TU116 processor, gives it a 200W power limit, and tops the chip with an over-built cooler for quiet operation at low temperatures. Is the marginally marked-up board worth an upgrade?
Product_Name: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1660 Ti Gaming OC 6G
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: Gigabyte’s GeForce GTX 1660 Ti Gaming OC 6G is the company’s flagship implementation, featuring overbuilt cooling, a generously-high power limit, and RGB lighting. Its price tag puts the Gaming OC 6G in contention with faster graphics cards, though, so we’d like to see it selling for less.
column14: Big thermal solution for a 120W GPU
column15: Big thermal solution for a 120W GPU

Title: ASRock DeskMini A300 Review: STX Meets AM4
Summary: The A300 adds AMD’s AM4 CPU socket support to ASRock’s DeskMini portfolio, complete with its enhanced onboard graphics and fast DDR4 support.
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: A combination of great efficiency, storage, and HDMI 2.0 opens the DeskMini to multiple end-user markets. But its lack of rear-panel connectors and somewhat high noise under heavy loads limits its appeal for some of those markets at the same time. If you find its limitations surmountable, it's a great compact computing solution.

Title: be quiet! Dark Rock Pro TR4 Review: Threadripping in Stealth Mode
Summary: Threadripper joins the Dark side: The be quiet! Dark Rock Pro TR4 is a quiet, impressive contender in the Threadripper cooling arms race.
Product_Name: be quiet! Dark Rock Pro TR4
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: With stealthy good looks, very quiet operation and straightforward installation, the Threadripper-specific Dark Rock Pro impresses. But if you want lower temps and can tolerate a slightly higher noise level, there are better, cheaper options.

Title: Biostar Racing B450GT3 Micro ATX Motherboard Review: Giant Value
Summary: Biostar’s new B450 board sometimes costs nearly as much as its X470 counterpart. Is stepping down to the lesser chipset worth the savings?
Product_Name: Biostar Racing B450GT3 Micro ATX Motherboard
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The Biostar Racing B450GT3 offers good overclocking and a feature set targeted at budget-minded performance seekers. It’s a great deal when you can find it at the right price, but if you can’t get it for around $100, you might want to wait, or look elsewhere.

Title: Corsair VS450 Power Supply Review: Affordable and Reliable
Summary: Is a super budget PSU like the Corsair VS450 good enough for a system that has low power requirements? Is it reliable enough?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Corsair VS450 is one of the most affordable 450-watt power supplies on the market, but you'll pay in decreased performance and efficiency.

Title: Cooler Master Wraith Ripper TR4 Cooler Review: Pretty but Pricey
Summary: Does the Wraith Ripper repay its high price and weight with high performance for Threadripper owners, or should they stick with liquid cooling alternatives?
Product_Name: Cooler Master Wraith Ripper TR4 Cooler
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: All (impressive) appearances aside, the Wraith Ripper struggles to restrain temps from our 32-core 2990WX clocked at 3.4Ghz and 1.20v compared to other large heatpipe coolers designed for AMD’s flagship CPUs. This despite a $120 price that puts it in liquid-cooler territory.
column14: Impressive design and unique RGB lighting
column15: Impressive design and unique RGB lighting

Title: GJS Geio Battle Robot Review: AR for a Sticky Price
Summary: The Geio robot has its own companion app boasting many games, including ones with object recognition for power-ups and a camera for first-person shooter views.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: Geio comes with its own companion app boasting an impressive number of games, including ones using object recognition for power-ups and a camera for first-person shooter views. However, the toy robot is a noisy piece of hardware, and its AR mode comes off as a makeshift afterthought.

Title: Gigabyte GeForce RTX 2060 Gaming OC Pro 6G Review: More Power, More MHz
Summary: Gigabyte's GeForce RTX 2060 Gaming OC Pro 6G benefits from a higher power limit than Nvidia's reference specification, which in turn yields higher clock rates. But it still runs cool and quiet thanks to a beefy Windforce 3X thermal solution.
Product_Name: Gigabyte GeForce RTX 2060 Gaming OC Pro 6G
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: Gigabyte’s GeForce RTX 2060 Gaming OC Pro 6G harnesses the strengths of Nvidia’s TU106 processor and adds an aggressive power limit to facilitate notably higher GPU frequencies. It’s cooled by a capable thermal solution, yielding quiet operation and relatively low temperatures. There’s consequently not much for us to complain about aside from this card’s premium price tag.
column14: 150 MHz faster than Nvidia’s reference spec
column15: 150 MHz faster than Nvidia’s reference spec

Title: be quiet! System Power U9 500W PSU Review: Affordable and Quiet
Summary: The be quiet! System Power U9 models are highly affordable. What about their performance though and are they quiet enough to carry on this brand's tradition?
Product_Name: be quiet! System Power U9 500W PSU
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: If you are on a tight budget and want a reliable, silent and competent performing power supply, the be quiet! SU9-500 is a solid choice.

Title: Asus X470 Crosshair VII Hero (Wi-Fi) Motherboard Review: High-Priced Excellence
Summary: The Asus X470 Crosshair VII pretty much defines of a top-tier board on AMD’s AM4 platform. But is the cost justified as competitors offer similar boards?
Product_Name: Asus X470 Crosshair VII Hero (Wi-Fi) Motherboard
Author: Jacob Terkelsen
column13: While it's unquestionably expensive, Asus' X470 Crosshair is a true hero board for serious AMD enthusiasts. It delivers great performance in all respects, and excellent I/O and expandability. If you're building an AMD-based extreme overclocking rig or a test bench, it should be on your short list.

Title: Philips 326E8FJSB Monitor Review: Jumbo Screen, Beer and Pizza Price
Summary: We’re checking out one of the least expensive 32-inch monitors available – Philips 326E8FJSB, a VA panel with FreeSync up to 75Hz
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: The Philips 326E8F leaves out a few non-essentials, like USB ports, speakers and a fancy stand. But it delivers bold and accurate color, excellent contrast and smooth video processing via FreeSync and 75Hz. Breaking price barriers for 32-inch screens, it’s definitely worth a serious look.

Title: Maingear Vybe 2019 (Stage 4) Gaming Desktop Review: Quiet and Quick-Shipping
Summary: Maingear's latest Vybe runs quiet and looks understated (for a gaming desktop). But the case could be nicer--especially in the $2,499 quick-ship configuration.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: If you’re after a smartly assembled, high-end gaming and productivity rig that ships fast and doesn’t cost much more than its components, Maingear’s Vype shouldn’t disappoint, unless you prioritize a flashier, more premium case.

Title: Gigabyte Z390 Gaming SLI Motherboard Review: Dollar Stretcher
Summary: Gigabyte decided to fully support Intel’s top LGA 1151 processor even in its cheapest Z390 boards. Does the Gaming SLI deliver?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The Z390 Gaming SLI is the only sub-$160 board we’ve tested that fully supports our Core i9-9900K, even at stock speed. If that’s your CPU of choice, that should mean more than the added features of its far-weaker competitors.
column14: Supports the full range of 9th-gen LGA 1151 processors
column15: Supports the full range of 9th-gen LGA 1151 processors

Title: Seasonic Focus SGX 650W SFX-L PSU Review: Reliable Power, Tiny Form Factor
Summary: Small and powerful, the Seasonic SSR-650SGX achieves good performance and backs it up with a long warranty and plenty of features.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: Small and powerful, the Seasonic SSR-650SGX achieves good performance and backs it up with a long warranty and plenty of features.

Title: SilverStone ST1200-PTS PSU Review: Compact But Powerful
Summary: The ST1200-PTS is the smallest, in dimensions, 1200W power supply that money can buy today, but can its compact dimensions affect the overall performance?
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The ST1200-PTS is the smallest 1200W PSU available, but to hit that tiny size, it compromises a bit on performance.

Title: Acer Nitro XV273K Gaming Monitor Review: 4K at 144Hz Gets Cheaper
Summary: The Acer Nitro XV273K makes a few compromises to get its price under $1,000. But it still offers fantastic 4K gaming at 144Hz, along with the ability to connect to both FreeSync and G-Sync systems.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: The Acer Nitro XV273K makes a few compromises to get its price under $1,000. But it still offers fantastic 4K gaming at 144Hz, along with the ability to connect to both FreeSync and G-Sync systems.

Title: Corsair VS650 Power Supply Review: Affordable Yet Capable
Summary: The Corsair VS650 is a highly affordable power supply suitable for mainstream systems with modest needs.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Corsair VS650 is a solid choice for the price, but it cuts corners on efficiency and noise.

Title: Corsair Crystal Series 680X RGB Case Review: Bigger and Better
Summary: If glass side panels, loads of RGB fans and dual-chambered design sound appealing, the Crystal Series 680X RGB might be for you--if you can take the high price.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: With its built-in addressable RGB lighting and USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C, the Corsair Crystal Series 680X RGB is a very stylish premium chassis. We just wish the company had included a riser cable for vertically mounting the graphics card and made front filter removal easier, especially given its $250 (£215.45) price.

Title: Gigabyte Aorus RGB M.2 NVMe SSD Review: RGB Comes to M.2
Summary: Gigabyte's Aorus RGB M.2 SSD brings the bling, and an elegant heatsink, to the M.2 form factor.
Product_Name: Gigabyte Aorus RGB M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Gigabyte’s AORUS RGB brings high-end performance, tons of write endurance, and a 5-year warranty all wrapped in a stylish heatsink and RGB lighting, making it a great buy for enthusiasts and casual users alike. Now, if only the RGB control were hardware agnostic…

Title: HP Spectre x360 13 (2019) Laptop Review: Best Consumer 2-in-1
Summary: HP’s Spectre x360 13-inch offers a best-in-class combination of style, portability and performance.
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: HP’s Spectre x360 13-inch offers a best-in-class combination of style, portability and performance.

Title: MSI MPG Z390M Gaming Edge: A Mid-Sized Value
Summary: Micro ATX fixes the compromises of Mini ITX but with only half of the space savings. Does the MPG Z390M Gaming Edge make good use of that extra space?
Product_Name: MSI MPG Z390M Gaming Edge: A Mid-Sized Value
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: The MPG Z390M Gaming Edge AC’s voltage regulator cooling is only sufficient for Core i9-9900K at stock speed, or for overclocking Core i7 or Core i5 processors. And its slot arrangement is only adequate for two double-slot cards at best. For buyers whose configurations fall within those limitations, it’s a solid deal.

Title: Corsair AX850 PSU Review: Top Performer and Dead Silent
Summary: The Corsair AX850 achieves top performance and it is reasonable priced, given its features. It surely is a worthy competitor to the digital AX860i.
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Corsair AX850 is the best 850-watt PSU you can get, thanks to its high-efficiency and low noise levels, but you’ll pay a premium for it.

Title: ASRock Phantom Gaming X Radeon RX590 8G OC Review
Summary: ASRock's Phantom Gaming X Radeon RX590 8G OC is the least expensive Radeon RX 590 available. But the even cheaper Radeon RX 580 and faster GeForce GTX 1660 Ti are compelling alternatives.
Product_Name: ASRock Phantom Gaming X Radeon RX590 8G OC Review
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: ASRock’s Phantom Gaming X earns a value win against its Radeon RX 590 competition. But the faster GeForce GTX 1660 Ti and more affordable Radeon RX 580 steal this card’s thunder. High power consumption and loud fans don’t help. Fortunately, it’s possible to tame the Phantom Gaming X’s transgressions using ASRock’s Phantom Gaming Tweak software.

Title: MyDigitalSSD M2X NVMe Enclosure Review: Put NVMe in Your Pocket
Summary: MyDigitalSSD's new MX2 enclosure unleashes the NVMe beast with the USB 3.1 Gen 2 speeds up to 1,000 MB/s.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Speed up your backups, add a new scratch disk to your workflow, or just build yourself an awesome external drive to take your games library on the go. The MyDigitalSSD M2X USB unleashes performance up to 1 GB/s if you pair the enclosure with the right NVMe SSD. At just $40, it’s a steal compared to the many other options on the market.

Title: Raidmax X08 Open Air Chassis Review: Style Over Substance
Summary: Raidmax's X08 is another in a trend of open-air mech-inspired cases built of metal and glass. Can it sidestep the value and design problems of its competition?
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: We like the look and thermal performance of open-air chassis like the Raidmax X08, but you have to be able to live with all the dirt, dust and pet hair that gets into your system. Also, $240 seems like a lot for essentially a skeleton of a frame with a couple aluminum and tempered glass panels, especially considering you'll need to bring your own fans.

Title: Corsair Carbide 678C Review: Old-School Cool
Summary: With its polished design and concealed external 5.25” bay, Corsair’s Carbide 678C is great for those who value old-school style and whisper-quiet operation.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: If style and silence are is high on your priorities list, Corsair's new Carbide Series 678C could be just the chassis you're looking for.

Title: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1660 Review: The Turing Onslaught Continues
Summary: By trimming a couple of SMs from TU116 and swapping GDDR6 for GDDR5 memory, Nvidia turns GeForce GTX 1660 Ti into a vanilla 1660. Does the $220 Turing-based board retain enough performance to outmaneuver Radeon RX 590, though?
Author: Chris Angelini
column13: Based on the same TU116 processor as GeForce GTX 1660 Ti, Nvidia’s GeForce GTX 1660 loses two Streaming Multiprocessors and swaps out GDDR6 memory for slower GDDR5. As a result, it remains an excellent choice for gaming at 1920x1080 but isn’t recommended for 2560x1440. Just be sure to comparison shop before making your purchase. Hot deals on Radeon RX 580 cards may warrant a look, despite their lower performance.

Title: Intel Core i9-9900KF Review: Disabled Graphics and No Discount
Summary: Intel's eight-core sixteen-thread Core i9-9900KF comes with disabled graphics but has a higher price tag than the full-featured Core i9-9900K.
Author: Paul Alcorn
column13: Intel’s Core i9-9900KF lacks integrated graphics, but includes all of the other features you get from Core i9-9900K, including eight cores, high frequencies, and a solder-based thermal interface material for improving cooling performance. Like its counterpart, the Core i9-9990KF is the fastest mainstream processor on the market. But unless it lands on shelves at a significant discount, you're better off waiting for the -9900K to enjoy better availability.
column14: Performance in both single- and multi-threaded workloads
column15: Performance in both single- and multi-threaded workloads

Title: Plugable USBC-NVMe SSD Enclosure Review: Tool-Free NVMe With USB Type-C
Summary: Plugable's USBC-NVMe enclosure lets you slap in a M.2 SSD for fast, portable storage.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: The Plugable USBC-NVMe enclosure speeds things up with 10Gb/s of throughput at your disposal. The $50 price point is affordable, while the tool-free design makes dropping in an M.2 SSD a snap.

Title: Cooler Master MasterCase NR600 Review: Budget Case Excellence
Summary: In the market for a sleek and stylish chassis that won't break the bank? Cooler Master’s latest MasterCase NR600 offers great looks, good performance and features galore, all for only $70.
Author: Steven Lynch
column13: Great looks, good performance, features galore, and a low price make the MasterCase a great value, despite its single intake fan and no Type-C connector.

Title: Acer Predator Triton 500 Review: RTX 2060 Holds its Own
Summary: The Acer Predator Triton 500 has a sleek, lightweight design and an RTX 2060 but is riddled with too much bloatware.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Acer Predator Triton 500 has a sleek, lightweight design and an RTX 2060 but is riddled with too much bloatware.

Title: Corsair One Pro i180 Review: Full Power in a Tiny Tower
Summary: Content creation professionals, take note. Corsair’s compact One Pro i180 is compact, powerful, and (mostly) quiet.
Author: Matt Safford
column13: Content creation professionals and pro-sumers with little desk space, take note. If you need serious computing muscle for tasks like high-end media production, you’ll be hard-pressed to find a better option than Corsair’s top-end One Pro i180.

Title: Lenovo Legion Y740 Gaming Laptop Review: Smooth Operator
Summary: The Lenovo Legion Y740 performs as well as it looks. Unfortunately, some physical flaws, like a nose-shooting webcam and weak keyboard hold it back.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The Lenovo Legion Y740 performs as well as it looks. Unfortunately, some physical flaws, like a nose-shooting webcam and weak questionable keyboard hold it back.

Title: Wooting One Keyboard Review: Analog Switches, Great for Your Digits
Summary: The Wooting One is a compact keyboard that stands alone, thanks to its analog switches and customizable actuation point.
Author: Alex Cox
column13: Packed with possibilities and pulled off with panache, the Wooting One is a compact keyboard that stands alone, thanks to its analog switches and customizable actuation point.

Title: Asus ROG Strix Z390-E Gaming Review: Stretching The Envelope
