Summary: IPVanish is an excellent VPN when it comes to speeds, connectivity and features. But there are concerns over its no-logging policy.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: IPVanish is an excellent VPN when it comes to speeds, connectivity and features. But there are concerns over its no-logging policy, due to U.S. jurisdiction and a past incident.

Title: MSI GE65 Raider Review: Laptop Gaming Done Right
Summary: The MSI GE65 Raider gaming laptop gets you the framerates and productivity power expected of more expensive machines.
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The MSI GE65 Raider delivers the framerates and productivity power expected of more expensive machines and does it all with a sophisticated, high-end design.

Title: StrongVPN Review: Strong and Simple
Summary: StrongVPN provides all the standard privacy mechanisms and strong encryption. But details on its no-logs policy are scarce.
Author: Sead Fadilpašić
column13: StrongVPN provides all the standard privacy mechanisms and strong encryption. But details on its no-logs policy are scarce and its more scant on subscription options and features than competitors.

Title: Deepcool Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro Review
Summary: Deepcool’s Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro lands on our test bench with an innovative leak-proof radiator design, sharp RGB lighting and a fully-functional coolant snorkel.
Product_Name: Deepcool Gamer Storm Captain 240 Pro Review
Author: Garrett Carver
column13: Retailing right at $130 (£100), the Captain 240 Pro comes in slightly higher in price than much of the competition, but the keen-eyed buyer who sees the value in Deepcool’s 240mm liquid cooler knows precisely what they want in this gem of a cooler.

Title: Lego Hidden Side Review: Ultimate AR Toy
Summary: Lego’s Hidden Side sets pair an impressive augmented reality experience with an addictive gaming experience and fun builds.
Author: Avram Piltch
column13: Lego’s Hidden Side sets pair an impressive augmented reality experience with an addictive gaming experience and fun builds.

Title: Audio-Technica ATH-G1 Gaming Headset Review: Understated and Powerful
Summary: Audio-Technica shows off excellent sound quality with the premium-priced ATH-G1 gaming headset and achieves it with a distinctive, powerful tone.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: Audio-Technica shows off excellent sound quality with the premium-priced ATH-G1 gaming headset and achieves it with a distinctive, powerful tone.

Title: SteelSeries Arctis 1 Gaming Headset Review: Comfortable, Breathable
Summary: There's a great package crammed into the SteelSeries Arctis 1, considering its budget price. But there are better-sounding headsets that are similarly priced.
Author: Phil Iwaniuk
column13: There's a great package crammed into the SteelSeries Arctis 1, considering its budget price. But there are better-sounding headsets available that cost just a little bit more.

Title: SteelSeries Apex 7 Review: OLED for Your Keys?
Summary: SteelSeries’ Apex 7 retains the design elements we liked in the pricier Pro, along with the OLED screen. But is that enough to justify its rather high $160 asking price?
Author: Nathaniel Mott
column13: The SteelSeries Apex 7 is a solid keyboard that lacks the per-key customization that made its counterpart, the Apex Pro, worth considering. It doesn’t quite justify its price because of the limited utility of its integrated OLED Smart Display and ubiquity of RGB-backlit keyboards.

Title: Gigabyte X570 Aorus Pro Wi-Fi Review: Well-Rounded Value
Summary: With an impressive set of features, including front-and-rear Gen2 USB options and Wi-Fi 6, plus attractive looks, this $270 X570 board from Gigabyte is worthy of serious consideration.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Gigabyte X570 Aorus Pro Wi-Fi proved itself to perform well in the stock testing as well overclocking, handling these stressful situations with ease. It has a pleasing feature set, including Wi-Fi 6 integration, front and rear USB 3.1 Gen 2 ports, and dual PCIe 4.0 x4 M.2 slots (both with heatsinks), along with RGB LED highlights. For $270, you’d be hard-pressed to find a better board with better features.
column14: Low price for the feature set
column15: Low price for the feature set

Title: ASRock X570 Phantom Gaming-ITX/TB3 Review: Full-Featured, Compact
Summary: ASRock's Phantom Gaming-ITX/TB3 includes a robust 10 Phase VRM, 7.1 channel Realtek ALC 1220 audio, integrated Wi-Fi 6 abilities, and one of the highest memory speed support listings we’ve seen, at DDR4 4533+(OC).
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The ASRock X570 Phantom Gaming-ITX/TB3 proved itself to perform well in our stock and overclocking testing. For those who need a Thunderbolt 3 port, this is one of the few boards that offer it. Though it has three USB 3.1 Gen 2 ports on the rear IO, it only has five in total. And the chipset fan was audible at stock settings. But for the $240 price tag, this diminutive board is an impressive, well-rounded solution for a small form factor build.

Title: ASRock X570 Aqua Review: Feature-Packed, Liquid-Cooled
Summary: Is the X570 Aqua interesting enough to win over "shock-and-awe" buyers?
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Apart from the lack of RGB around the monoblock’s main window and outlet port, most of the this board's cons don’t suually apply to the X570 Aqua’s target market. Once ASRock rolls out an update to its RGB software, Aqua will be a near-perfect product for those who don’t mind blowing $1000 on a motherboard.
column14: Excellent cooling of voltage regulator and PCH
column15: Excellent cooling of voltage regulator and PCH

Title: Patriot Viper VP4100 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Wicked Fast With an Edgy Design
Summary: Patriot's Viper is ready to strike
Product_Name: Patriot Viper VP4100 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Patriot’s Viper VP4100 is a wicked fast PCIe 4.0 x4 M.2 NVMe SSD that features an edgy looking and efficient heatsink. If you are a gamer or a prosumer that wants a high-end SSD, be sure to check this SSD out.

Title: Asus TUF Gaming X570-Plus Wi-Fi Review: Solid Features for $200
Summary: With a solid feature set including USB-C and Wi-Fi at a budget price for this platform, Asus’ TUF Gaming X570 Plus WiFi is a solid choice for a mid-range AMD build.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The Asus TUF Gaming is one of the least-expensive boards available on the X570 platform,but manages to include a USB Type-C port as well as Wi-Fi, and RGB LED illumination near the chipset heatsink. Stock performance was comparable to the other models, and overclocking worked well on our review sample.

Title: Gigabyte X570 Aorus Elite Motherboard Review: Sub-$200 Goodness
Summary: Those looking for an affordable entry to X570 will find a lot to like with this board from Gigabyte. It lacks USB-C and debug LEDs, but includes an M.2 heatsink.
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The sub-$200 X570 Aorus Elite offers a wallet-friendly inroad to AMD’s latest platform. It forgoes some of the extras like USB Type-C, Wi-Fi and lots of RGB. But it handled overclocking our Ryzen 7 3700X without a complaint and performed well in our testing.

Title: Kingston A2000 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Security, Endurance, and Low Pricing
Summary: Kingston's A2000 may not be the fastest, but it offsets that with enhanced security and low pricing.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: Looking to outfit your Ultrabook or new build with a fast and secure NVMe SSD? Kingston’s A2000 is a top pick with hardware encryption, competitive performance, and great pricing too.

Title: Woo-dy Mechanical Keyboard Review: For Aficionados Only
Summary: Retro style, walnut finish, mechanical switches and wireless connectivity.
Author: Alex Cox
column13: If you like its actual wood construction, there's nothing quite like this keyboard.

Title: Zotac Mek Mini Review: Big Things in Small Packages
Summary: It’s not the size of the system, it’s the frames of the games.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The Zotac Mek Mini’s size means it takes up little space, and its powerful with up to an RTX 2070 Super and an Intel Core i7. But the two massive laptop-like power bricks disguise much of the system’s true bulk.

Title: ASRock X570 Steel Legend WiFi ax Review: Legendary Value For Ryzen 3000?
Summary: A solid value for Ryzen 3000, though PCIe and M.2 SSD options could be more flexible
Product_Name: ASRock X570 Steel Legend WiFi ax
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Though it’s not ideal for some of the fancier graphics and storage options of the high-end market, the X570 Steel Legend offers Ryzen 3000 buyers great stability and efficiency at a reasonable price.
column14: Mid-sized voltage regulator on a value-priced board
column15: Mid-sized voltage regulator on a value-priced board

Title: Phanteks Eclipse P400A Review: Airflow and RGB Mastery
Summary: A nice evolutionary update to an old classic
Author: Zak Storey
column13: The Phanteks Eclipse P400A, is a nice evolutionary update to an old classic, it packs in better airflow, some solid RGB fans, and a good build experience, but does little to innovate outside of that front panel.

Title: Oloy WarHawk DDR4-3200 Review: RGB Value at 32GB?
Summary: Should you choose Oloy memory? YOLO
Author: Thomas Soderstrom
column13: Oloy puts a noticeable discount on top of the same memory that its competitors sell. Users can rely on getting the same stability and overclocking potential, but the life of the brand is yet to be determined. Given that we like to upgrade our PCs every few years, we still think it’s a good deal.

Title: MyDigitalSSD BPX Pro NVMe SSD Review: Big on Endurance, Small on Price
Summary: The BPX Pro is a great SSD for prosumers and media content creators. The drive offers a good balance of power efficiency, comes with a five-year warranty, and given its competitive pricing, it delivers an impressive performance to endurance ratio.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: MyDigitalSSD’s 1.92TB BPX Pro comes with a very hefty endurance of 3115 TBW, or about eight times that of the Intel SSD 660p. While it isn’t a chart-topper in application performance, the 1.92TB BPX Pro still offers plenty of performance and high capacity for a great price. At just $229.99, it's one of the cheapest 2TB SSDs available and earns our recommendation.

Title: WD Blue SN550 M.2 NVMe SSD Review: Best DRAMless SSD Yet
Summary: WD’s Blue SN550 delivers good mainstream performance at rock-bottom prices.
Product_Name: WD Blue SN550 M.2 NVMe SSD
Author: Sean Webster
column13: WD’s Blue SN550 is a substantial update to the Blue line-up. It is fast, efficient, and comes into the market at a low cost per GB. We highly recommend it to those looking for a low-cost M.2 drive.

Title: LaCie Rugged SSD Review: Tough, Secure, and Fast
Summary: LaCie’s Rugged SSD is a premium, professional-class portable SSD with top-notch security.
Author: Sean Webster
column13: LaCie’s Rugged SSD is a fast, secure portable SSD designed to handle rough conditions on the go -- or a tough fall from your desk. If you’re in need of a professional portable SSD for work, it's a top pick.

Title: AOC Agon AG493UCX Monitor Review: 4 Feet of Mega-Wide Gaming Goodness
Summary: A 49-inch, 32:9 curved panel is no joke when it comes to gaming.
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: Though it doesn’t render HDR as well as some more expensive monitors, the AOC Agon AG493UCX delivers everything else necessary for a killer gaming experience. FreeSync and 120Hz unite with excellent contrast and tremendous width to bring players deep into the gaming environment. It’s a great alternative to multiple displays.

Title: Acer Swift 5 (2020) Review: Featherweight Fighter
Summary: Acer’s latest iteration of the Swift 5 ultra light is able to keep up with contemporaries at a fraction of the cost.
Author: Michelle Ehrhardt
column13: The Acer Swift 5 is a lighter and cheaper approach to premium laptop design, offering mid-level productivity at a more approachable price point than competitors.

Title: Phanteks AMP Series 750W Power Supply Review
Summary: The Phanteks AMP 750W achieves good performance in almost all sections and it is backed up by a hefty ten-year warranty.
Product_Name: Phanteks AMP Series 750W Power Supply Review
Author: Aris Mpitziopoulos
column13: The Phanteks AMP 750W uses a popular Seasonic platform, so its good performance is no surprise. The fan speed profile could be a bit more relaxed, though.

Title: Half-Life: Alyx Gameplay Review: (Almost) Every VR Headset Tested
Summary: Critics can no longer say that we don’t have a killer app for VR. Half-Life: Alyx is the real deal.
Author: Kevin Carbotte
column13: Half-Life: Alyx is one of the best VR games you can get right now. It has a deep story and characters with personality. This is a game that you could sink some real time into and has all the trappings of a proper AAA title.

Title: HP ZBook 15 G6 Review: Maxxed Out Workstation
Summary: The HP ZBook 15 G6 is a powerful workstation with a Xeon processor and Quadro RTX GPU, but it's expensive for those parts.
Author: Andrew E. Freedman
column13: The HP ZBook 15 G6 is a powerful workstation with a Xeon processor and Quadro RTX GPU. It's also easy to upgrade, but expensive for the parts you get.

Title: Lenovo ThinkPad P1 (Gen 2) Review: A Thinner Workstation
Summary: A slim, OLED-equipped workhorse
Author: Michelle Ehrhardt
column13: The Lenovo ThinkPad P1 (Gen 2) offers workstation-level power and premium feel at a slight discount while still fitting in your bag.

Title: ASRock RX 5600 XT Phantom Gaming D3 Review: Competently Large
Summary: The ASRock RX 5600 XT has a that massive cooler helps with noise and temperatures, but is it the best 5600 XT option?
Product_Name: ASRock RX 5600 XT Phantom Gaming D3
Author: Joe Shields
column13: The ASRock RX 5600 XT Phantom Gaming D3 performed well, averaging over 60+ fps at 1080p using ultra settings, or at 1440p with medium to high settings. This is a good card in the $300 price bracket, though it's outperformed by the less expensive Gigabyte Gaming OC 6G.

Title: WD My Passport Portable Hard Drive Review: Slim, Spacious and Secure
Summary: WD’s My Passport is a high capacity portable HDD boasting top-notch security
Product_Name: WD My Passport Portable Hard Drive
Author: Sean Webster
column13: WD’s My Passport is slimmer than ever and affordably priced. With a 3-year warranty and hardware encryption, it’s a well-backed and secure option for those looking for dense portable storage

Title: HyperX Cloud Alpha S Gaming Headset Review: Airy Fit, Virtual Surround Sound
Summary: The HyperX Cloud Alpha S gaming headset adds virtual surround sound and bass sliders to an already impressive headset, but with varying results.
Product_Name: HyperX Cloud Alpha S Gaming Headset
Author: Scharon Harding
column13: The HyperX Cloud Alpha S offers a lot for its price, including a lightweight fit and handy inline controls. But its bass adjustment sliders are forgettable.

Title: Gigabyte Aorus FI27Q Gaming Monitor Review: 27-Inch 1440p Done Right
Summary: Near-perfect color, superb gaming performance
Author: Christian Eberle
column13: Though it doesn’t provide any image enhancement in HDR mode, the Gigabyte Aorus FI27Q delivers a superb picture with rich, saturated and accurate color, along with 165Hz and Adaptive-Sync.

Title: Patriot Viper V380 Gaming Headset Review: RGB Meets Virtual Surround
Summary: Tasteful RGB and high-end features
Author: Fionna Agomuoh
column13: o experience for games, music and movies, even with sparse audio controls in its software. Its virtual surround sound sometimes proved handy for games, and its RGB lighting is attractive and easily controllable.
column14: Virtual surround sound can be helpful for games, movies
column15: Virtual surround sound can be helpful for games, movies
